It is one of those rare hotels where you can still get a smoking room. My room was spacious and had everything I needed for a relaxing get away. It was exceptionally clean and the food was delicious, with a good range.  The staff were friendly and there is a great spa in the hotel where I spent the day being pampered. Good air conditioning, high speed wifi which was great for skyping my family over Christmas and there was

While the dirty and worn out carpets in the hallway may concern about the choice of the hotel you picked, the rooms are well kept - Good sized room and well kept wash room. The towels looks and feel worn out and the minbar was empty.   The entrance is cramped with more cars than they could fit in the parking.

Stayed here for 3 nights recently - once you are inside the hotel gates you feel very secure at all times. Clean modern hotel with good reception area - I had a junior suite on the 4th floor. White tiled floors throughout, huge comfortable bed and a good bathroom with double sink, shower and a large comfortable bath - a very nice room.  The Resturant was mainly typical Nigerian food with a pasta and noodles chef - good breakfast as well - if you missed breakfast then there is a coffee lounge on the ground floor, pastries etc   All in all a good standard on Lagod island and I would definitely go again

Good: Great dinner and breakfast. Friendly staff. Good outside bar area. Rooms are nice. Bad: only one elevator working, laundry does not always bring back all your clothes, lucky draw with massage - some are definitely qualified whilst others seem to have no idea what they are doing and end up hurting you. Nothing in bar fridge.

Down decent business hotel. Stayed here for 3 months and in different rooms, so got a good detailed look at it. Honestly, I was undecided between 3 and 4 stars and the truth probably lies inbetween. The reason I opted for 4 is that staff is really friendly and tries to make your life more comfortable. On the plus side, the rooms have a decent size, location is rather central, gym is quite good and food decent. Now on the negative, the rooms, especially the bathrooms could do with an overhaul, the food menu is quite limited and gets boring within a couple of days, internet is average and the service is, although friendly, sometimes inconsistent. But then, for Lagos standards, its quite good :-)
Review Text

Rooms are spacious, staff the most friendly ever, check in procedure a bit long but not to complain about, grilled seafood at the terrace restaurant is excellent and it is perfectly located for any business meetings one may have in Lagos.  Yet, there is a humidity issue in the rooms which is addressed with extremely low temperature AC. Not a very effective resolution. They could do something about it. Breakfast service is the only non-friendly in the whole facility.

Review Title: Best value for money in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed at a few hotels in Lagos. This hotel is the best value for money. Good facilities, well located, clean and modern. Lobby can be very hectic at times but for the money its an excellent option for the business traveller in Lagos.

Review Title: They Have Responded to Customer Service Complaints
Review Text: I reviewed the Four Points in October and gave it a poor review based on the front desk staff's lack of good customer service.  I returned this past week to give them another chance and they had replaced most of the former staff. The new staff were wonderful and helpful. Thank you for listening Four Points!

Stayed at Four points on my first and last day in Lagos over a week tour of Nigeria. Despite the fact that check-in was really hectic on both days due to high occupancy, the rooms we finally got were spot on awesome.  Breakfast is world class and the restaurant on the open lounge has an amazing live band in the evening. I will be back soon.

Review Title: Nice corner in Victoria Island, Lagos
Review Text: Having been here a few times already, I was delighted by the Christmas ambience last month. The hotel was decorated in festive colours, within and without. It was calling to celebrating and at the same time restive (perhaps it was tired day, perhaps it was the soothing music in the lobby). I felt very welcome indeed.  Though there was no choice of freshly squeezed orange juice (my preference) the ground floor restaurant had the usual gamut of beverages.

My last stay at Four points by Sheraton Lagos was excellent, It was a business trip and staff make my stay memorable start from my check-in till  check-out.  I am a SPG member and i received very warm welcome from reception staff as SPG guest. i was treated as a valued guest through out my stay, which push me to write on tripadvisor about the hotel.  I strongly recommend Four points by Sheraton to my friends and my colleagues, However my next trip is due soon. I hope to receive same type of service.

Enjoyed my time here with family during the Xmas season. Room service is prompt and the staff are efficient. The hotel has an open lounge with a live band playing in the evening. Good spot to hang out with friends.

I enjoyed my evening there at 2nd floor open air bar in live music. my kids were enjoyed a lots in the lobby with extensive xmas setup. Farrukah Maqbool is very helpful Manager. overall it was a such a good experience.

I went to Four Points because of colleague of mine prefers to stay there. And it was not the eye opener he told me it would be. The staff was very nice and correct. A lot of trainees at the front desk but they were properly instructed so that all went smooth. The room was more then OK and the bed was a actually very very nice. The coffee shop was good and they had a good variety of pastries, tea, coco and of course coffee. I had less charm for the restaurant. The main color there was brown. A lot of it and different shades of brown. Really depressing. Then I noticed that it all looked "used" and a little unorganised and that is the toner in the entire hotel. Clean but used. Specially thinks like the toilets. Brrrr

Review Title: Business Trip and Stay in Comfort
Review Text: A short stay at Four point recently made me realized how wrong i was by not selecting the hotel before. very well maintained , very friendly staff . location is not grand but as  business traveler i had short access to my destinations and abundance of trust-able taxi drivers.  the only wish i had was an offering of halal food , it was not clear what is hala and what is not in restaurant.
Review Text

I have always liked Four Points by Sheraton in Lagos. During my last visit in Nov 2015 my agent had inadvertently mixed up my reservation with Sheraton Hotel but the front desk staff at Four Points were extra helpful in resolving the issue and settling me in as quickly as possible. Thank you.

I am stayed in this hotel as part of the business trip to Lagos. Found this hotel much convenient, and better than Southern Sun Ikoyi where I had stayed earlier. The breakfast is average, however the coffee shop is extremely good. Due to the christmas rush, i initially stayed in the executive room and later moved to the standard room which was booked for me. I did not see much difference though between both the type of the rooms.The amenities in the hotel are excellent, and you won't be disappointed with that.

This is a Lagos hotel so be prepared for very friendly but not always efficient service.  The facilities are generally decent but the spa is particularly excellent.  The food is big on Nigerian fare.  There is also a rooftop bar/dining on the sixth floor that is a good place to look out over Lagos and take in the night views.

Hotel is excellent, room, service, food, coffee. Especially I enjoy with "Your Spa & Fitness" in here. Definitely recommend Misan, she is professional, very nice, make me feel comfortable and relaxing.

I was a delegate at a Media International event that was hosted at this hotel. I loved their coffee to begin with and the cakes. There's a lounge with a coffee shop and an inside bar with a football theme which I found to be so cool.  The conference Hall was arranged in a different manner from the usual, landscape which I felt was well thought.  Room service plus the room, you'd think they were born together. For lack of a better word. I liked the place, am sure you will too.

Came here for a business meeting and then again for their buffet breakfast. It's one of the better meeting points for discussions or dining in Lagos. The breakfast was ok, as was the coffee's. Service was friendly enough. Would gladly come back.

So firstly, the hotel was clean, staff friendly and good facilities including a pool. My room was very large, however there were building works at the back of the hotel, with some rather interesting goings on.. Fortunately it wasn't noisy when I was in the room..   What makes this place was rather the rooftop bar, which we spent a few evenings, the place was always busy and the staff so friendly and attentive we were glad we could relax here. Lots of great suya from grill although little no vegetarian food, lucky I like plantains!

I was at Four points for their Signature spa pampering session; session lasts about two hours and 15 minutes Session covers: Full Body Signature Balinese massage, Sauna Hydrotherapy, Full Body Exfoliation  My main reason for checking out the place was for my back muscle pains, and the therapists did a good job straightening it. The steam bath too was very very refreshing. I recommend their service to anyone looking for a nice spa on the Island.

Hotel was nice and clean, but I was upset that the electricity was switched off for half a day. Thankfully, the manager was nice and upgraded our room for free. The major downfall was in the fact that we never got credit for our SPG account. We contacted the reservation personnel Ijeoma Odum via email and she promised to look into it. Another personnel by the name of Tolulope Adewole requested additional details which was provided to her. Almost a year later, we still haven't heard back regarding this. As much as we loved our stay there, and are getting ready to make another trip, not having this resolved is poor customer service and will end up costing them loyal customers.

Great rooms with lovely breakfast, nice pool, spa and gym. Great outdoor bar with good food and comfortable seating. A little pricey to be sure but most hotel bars are. My hotel of choice when going to Lagos.
Review Text

This hotel was recommended as probably the best hotel in Lagos, and it did not disappoint. Great Gym, good bars for socialising and relaxing, comfortable rooms, good service. Loved the New Zealand wines on offer at good prices. Secure location, within relatively easy reach of meetings.

I had my birthday dinner here a couple of years ago and it was great. I also had the opportunity of spending my wedding night here recently and I must say I was quite impressed. The staff were very courteous and the room was fantastically decorated with petals from the bedroom to the bath tub though previously arranged by my husband but was very well executed. We also had breakfast the next morning and this was very nice with a wide selection from the buffet. I would say this is a nice hotel and would recommend same for anyone looking to spend some nights on the island.

Review Title: Great facility but not better than average service
Review Text: We stayed at the four points in January 2015 for about 9 nights, this was our 2nd visit & I must say the overall experiences were the same. This is an international brand with great facilities unfortunately, i can't say the same about  service. On several occasions, they got our meal order wrong & even when we complained, the staff would argue with us about what they thought we meant. Who does that in the hospitality industry? Arguing with a customer! The other instance was the house keeping staff who kept answering calls & talking leisurely while cleaning our room in our presence. Very unprofessional! Considering the price charged and being part of the SPG brand, i would expect that service would be at a much higher level. Being a platinum member with the SPG loyalty programme

Review Title: Great Restaurant in Ikeja Lagos.. close to airport
Review Text: An impeccable facility with a great menu,  excellent customer service and fine dining!  Their steaks were super tender and flavor some! The staff were very attentive and aimed to satisfy. I would recommend this restaurant for business or social occasions. Pricey but good value for sure.

Review Title: Customer Service? Not on your life!
Review Text: At the price they charge you would expect "reasonable" customer service at this International hotel. To be first ignored for 20 minutes trying to check in and then being rude with "what's your problem?!), I would not recommend staying here. The facility is beautiful, but my room had no soap in the bathroom, most of the amenities were missing (shower cap, shampoo, etc). I cannot understand how they get away with the lack of training or oversight of their staff. I will never stay here again.

Very loud music at reception, so loud you can't even hear the lady's behind the reception desk, but their reaction to requesting it should be turned to background level, is, "That our standard" end of story

Review Title: Average 3 star hotel in Victoria Island Lagos
Review Text: Four Points by Sheraton are budget hotel version... like Holiday Inn express sort /  Silk air by Singapore Airlines / Jetlite by Jet Airways...etc...  This hotel otherwise is good hotel fulfills basic minimum requirement any business traveler is looking for.  I am writing this review after my recent stay in Eko hotel within Victoria Island and hence I must confess that Four Point's my rating has improved from "poor" to average in relative terms -->  One can be better compared when you have experienced another or a base line !!!  Good part of this hotel is - rooms are specious, (but w/o carpet) has almost uninterrupted wi-fi  services, and an decent breakfast menu, which all are 40% lower than  nearby "5 star" rated Eko hotel.    All these hotels within Victoria Island are

Review Title: 6 recent photos, clean and safe business hotel, with spa facilities and reliable free internet access.
Review Text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this property. Overall, it exceeded my expectations for a hotel in Nigeria.  The hotel reflects many of the attributes of a Four Points property in the developed world. The rooms are clean and comfortable with coffee/tea making facilities and a plentiful supply of complimentary bottled water. The room floors are tiled and are nicely swept.  While I was at the hotel, the housekeeping was generally good and the cleanliness of the room was great. However for the second and third nights, I was missing towels or amenities, which I assume were taken by the staff or the hotel was short. This was probably the only part of the hotel that reminded me that I was in the third world.  The complimentary internet access was reliable for the days that I was

Stayed at the Sheraton Four Points in Lagos this week and while the staff was as friendly as any I have encountered, the service was often glacially slow. We ordered a bottle of wine with dinner and it was delivered unopened after we had almost finished eating. I asked if they had a corkscrew and the waiter eventually opened the bottle. My room was just ok. It had tile floors and my feet stuck to whatever they used to clean the floor. The air conditioning blew extremely humid and not do cold air. One last problem was that, like many chain hotels, this hotel didn't have a top sheet, but rather one of those comforter/sheet covers. That might be a good idea at the North Pole, but in a tropical hell hole, it doesn't make for a good nights sleep. All hotels should lose those

I usually love going to the Four Points for brunch and to visit the spa but I will never go back there again. On August 9th, 2015 I went to meet friends for drinks at the rooftop bar. I was coming from the office, wearing a long dress with long sleeves and a high neckline. I was refused entry on the grounds that the hotel no longer allows single women to enter the hotel premises. It was humiliating as I was told to stand to the side as they let other people enter. I was told that the only way I could enter is if I called a male friend to escort me in. I called one of my friends that I was meeting for drinks to come and help me get in. Afterwards we spoke to the manager on duty who seemed more apologetic to my male friend for having to leave the bar area to come meet me than he
Review Text

Business friendly hotel  and wonderful at night for those willing to catch fun. Located in the heart of Lagos Business  hub (Victoria island and lekki). The hotel food is wonderful as well.  A turnoff of was the inabilityo f staff to manage the the overwhelming number of guests during my stay

This hotel is located in the Oniru area of Lagos and has a very great facade.  The gate needs to be widened though as our bus kept on scraping the kerbs.  We stayed there as a group of 7 and had meetings everyday and a tour of Lagos during the Independence day.  Our stay was for 2 nights. I would recommend this hotel to any business person going to Lagos, especially if your clients are near the airport or in Ikeja area.

Review Title: Perfect start to an awesome holiday!
Review Text: Friendly staff, accompanied by efficient service. The rooms were clean and as expected of the Four Points by Sheraton. This was my first stop on my tour through Nigeria and would most certainly return and recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Review Title: First time in Nigeria, Excellent Hotel and Staff
Review Text: This was my first time visiting Nigeria, and it will definitely not be my last.  The Four Points by Sheraton is an excellent hotel in an excellent location.  On arrival, the staff were very helpful, my room was excellent, and the food was both very good and reasonable.  One thing you must check out is the outside terrace, excellent place to unwind after a hard day.  Many thanks to all of the staff there.

I traveled to Lagos on a short business trip and stayed at this hotel.  My room was very large, and nicely decorated.  The only practical, energy-saving, smart but yet irritating thing was the room key card that also controls the light. The card goes inside a "device" to keep the lights on and has to be removed at night to turns them off, ALL of them.  This means that in the middle of the night, in the pitch black, asleep and disoriented (the 1st night at least), you have to remember where you left the room card, as no light works, or feel your way across the cold floor, to the bathroom. There should be at least 1 night light that works independent from this whole system (if there is one, I could not find it).  Other that you must try the delicious, finger-licking good grilled

The rooms are very big and well equipped, the hotel offers a wide range of bars, restaurants, gym, swimming pool and spa. Overpriced but this is usual in west Africa, food not particularly tasty and by far too expensive.

Had an event at the hotel and apart from the fact that it was crazy expensive during the event there was a black out during the show and the staff took their sweet time in ensuring that back up generators were working. The shocker is that no apology was made instead they tried cook up silly excuses. Really sad

I have stayed at this hotel twice, on business. Although a very nice hotel the first thing that I noticed on entry was the very small car park- finding parking space is certainly a problem. Front desk staff were helpful and welcoming. Security within this hotel is very good as you need your room key card to operate the lift with exception of the 1st and 2nd floors where the restaurants are based. The bed was not as comfortable as I would have liked and found it difficult to sleep well. The large shower head in the standard bathtub was not ideal and the water tended to go everywhere which I think is a bit of a design error. I stayed on 7th floor and found the corridors in the lead up to my room cold, narrow and a little unnerving. That said, staff were great, food was always very

My husband & I stayed here for a night on a weekend in August and we had a lovely time. The check in/out was a breeze. The staff at the reception desk was efficient but could have been a little friendlier in my opinion. Our room was cosy but spacious enough for two and very elegantly furnished. I'm a TV girl & the TV selection was very good. Wifi was efficient too, and we could connect with two devices. The breakfast & dinner buffet were quite extensive and yummy but expensive, as expected in most hotels in Lagos. The restaurant staff were very attentive but one guy was quite eager about how we intend to pay which we didn't like. The high point of the stay was when the salon was opened earlier than usual for me to have a blow dry on Saturday morning while the downside was

Review Title: Quiet, Well Appointed Property in Lekki
Review Text: This hotel has all of things one would want for a fine quality business stay in Lagos. Convenient location, various restaurants on the property and very quiet rooms for a good sleep. The icing on the cake is the staff, each of whom is professional, courteous, and will go out their way to accommodate requests.
Review Text

Review Title: Good Hotel on the Lagos Island
Review Text: I find this to be a good hotel along the Lekki Road.  You do not want to miss the buffet breakfast.  Also, you may want to book your hotel room in advance if you want to both get a room and a good rate at the same time.

Overnighted in May and liked it so much that I returned in August for another overnight.  Inside the lobby is big, gleaming, and polished with minimal yet chic decor.....Nothing major to report about the Check-in/Check-out process....I could care less if you smile at me or chat me up during the process....all am concerned about is getting into my room (and a FREE upgrade all the better but if not no yawa) or checking out of my room without undue hassle and so for that purpose those attending to me really tried and succeeded in doing their job....I divert abit but the check-in/check-out process made me notice how some people lose their manners, sense of civility...they see a person queuing yet still jut to the front desk to be served...or they see the attendant attending to a

Review Title: Terrible experience...staff were either poorly trained, rude or both!
Review Text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel on our wedding night and few days just before heading off to Paris for the honeymoon proper. This informed booking a suite for the weekend hoping to have a quiet, relaxing weekend.  The disappointments began at check in. We ended up with a room close to the elevator despite pleas that my 4 month old daughter was a light sleeper and would be awoken by noise in the hallway. Requested for a fruit platter that never came. The next morning we planned to spend the day at the pool but were told that the pool was unavailable due to a private event. At this point we decided to cut short our stay and go some place else to complete our weekend.

I stayed here for 5 nights in July. I understand Lagos is not a cheap place when it comes to Hotel accommodation and was proved right. Meals at the hotel restaurant were expensive too as compared to other cities I've been to in Africa. Staff was friendly save for one lady at the reception who had some bit of attitude - one guest even told her to work on being courteous. My room was nice though and WiFi worked well which is very important for me.

Review Title: Lovely hotel with a great staff
Review Text: I stayed at the Four Point in Lagos for a week while there on business. The hotel was more than gracious to have us there. Every part of our stay was above anything we expected. Food was great. Drinks were plentiful and most of all the staff was incredibly courteous and accommodating. My first time to Lagos from the US and will go back there in a second. No problems with their wifi, used it to call back to Los Angeles through Skype and no delays at all - a little freaky when you think about it!

Nice hotel, large room, very clean, breakfast was very good, shopping possibilities available right next door.This hotel has a big swimming pool, a very nice outdoor restaurant, a gym and a tennis court. The staff here are very nice people It's such a great place to be. You should all come, too!

The hotel is clean and simple. The staff were pleasant and friendly. The room and bathroom were clean and bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was good and quite a wide variety.  On the downside , the parking space is small. Though located in a busy area, it is quiet .  On the whole, I will stay here again.

It's a nice hotel with a nice sportsbar, a terrace restaurant and a normal restaurant. All of those are good, sometimes service can be a bit slow though. Hotel pool not really recommended. Did not check the gym.  Rooms are spacious and clean. Try to get a room facing away from the street (due to car noise and sometimes music from the terrace bar).  Location is good for business on VI. But Lagos traffic is always bad, so make sure to take that into account.  In general the hotel is not as good anymore as it has been 1-2 years ago. The hotel director changed from an Austrian guy to a German guy.

The hotel is nice and well maintained. The rooms are clean but the view is disturbing as it is still VI. The bathing room is clean but somehow not comfortable as the shower inside the bath. The AC works but makes much noise and it stops when reaching the selected degree. The breakfast is fair and basic, the service is excellent. The GYM is clean and has all the relevant facilities. A big draw back is that there is no garden. I would recommend the hotel as it is still VI.

The hotel has a standard sheraton feel. it is situated in a strategic location on the Island. The service was good, though I once experienced the hot water was not coming out when I took a shower. But nontheless, I would recomend this hotel to anyone seeking to stay in a decent place in Lagos (whether on businesss or on pleasure).
Review Text

Review Title: Four Points by Sheraton is very accomodating!
Review Text: Wonderful 7 day stay, great enthusiastic staff, gourmet food and comfortable rooms. I wish they had a coffee machine in every room but other than that....quite wonderful. I always felt safe, secure and rested!!!!

Review Title: Good if you dont go out of VI
Review Text: Pros: Good hotel,  safe, rooms are clean , food not bad, good terrace restaurant 2d floor,  Cons: Traffic is the biggest Problem ..  very far from airport and city 3hrs from airport and min2 hrs to anyplace down in Lagos  Very expensive No airport transfers Also regular power outages  Not recommended at all if your business out of the island..traffic jam immediatley in front of hotel entrance..

Review Title: Stay at Four points Sheraton Lagos
Review Text: Stay at Four points Sheraton was good. Location of the hotel is centrally located and viable from accessibility point of view. The only issue is the traffic jam at the road in front of the entrance of the hotel.

This hotel is at the junction of the toll gate between the bridge and Victoria island .  Although all locations in Lagos are tricky, this is a good one to be in. Good food, good rooms , and the staff are extremely helpful.   The only disappointing thing is that all restaurants and pubs have a defined opening time. You Can't walk in after a long meeting and expect to find an open restaurant.  The restutant on the 2nd floor does some amazing grills.....absolutely loved it.  Great location for business.

I stayed here for a few days on a business trip. The facilities are good with all that a traveller requires - breakfast, gym, pool. The room is comfortable but on the 4th floor the bar on the 2nd floor can be a little noisy. The staff were friendly. Thefood is good but failrly standard. The bars in the hotel are pretty good. Overall, a good place to stay for a business trip and especially if your business is on the island. Otherwise book into a hotel on the mainland because traffic can be an issue going and coming from this location.

I stayed in this hotel for a few days during one of my trips to Nigeria. If your activities is within Victoria Island this is an ok place to stay as it close to shopping mall and cinema as well. The buffet there is very nice. It's always one activity or the other that takes place in the hotel, so you will see many people moving around......this depends on the angle you are looking at it. There was a life band playing one of the days but I don't know if this is a norm.

Review Title: Good atmosphere but slow and bad service
Review Text: I have stayed recently (last week) for a full week there, the welcome experience was not as I expected at all and I have not even been treated as SPG member. The service in breakfast area is really bad you can hardly find someone around to bring you the basic stuff (I have even asked 3 people for a fork to use) I didn't find the stuff to be friendly as they supposed to be.

Four Points is maybe not a newest hotel, but well maintained, with friendly staff and efficiently organized. Breakfast is good, the terrace bar very nice and buffet restaurant acceptable. Somehow despite being a little more aside than International it was faster to get in. Good, reasonably priced choice for VI/Ikoiy

Stayed 2 nights during a business trip at the hotel. Really enjoyed my stay there, as it was/is centric (close to the office) - shopping mall just down the road. Friendly staff, and the breakfast was really the first highlight of the day.  only the dinner (buffet) was a bit disappointing (value for money) - but overall - recommended.

We stay in a lovely spacious room. The hotel has been well maintained with a lovey ambiance. The staff provided impeccable service. The wifi was relatively fast. I had a lovely birthday dinner. What else can I ask for? I will definitely be coming back for weekends with my family
Review Text

Review Title: A spa hotel with a difference
Review Text: I spent 8 pretty comfortable nights in this hotel which has some excellent features. The room was very large and well equipped - perfect for business or pleasure. The bathroom was adequate but the hot water took a long time to come through in the shower and then wasn't blistering hot, but certainly adequate for the climate.  The air conditioning was very loud and I had to turn it off to sleep, but the bed was really comfy with large, fluffy pillows. I was disappointed that there was no decaf coffee available in the room and one day my room was nit even looked at, so I arrived back from work with no coffee or milk and an unmade bed.  The main restaurant was excellent, but was a set price for dinner so, even if you just wanted a starter salad, full price was paid. I defy anyone to

I was at the Four Point hotel for a conference and stayed there for 5 night. Fantastic conference facilities and with great services. the rooms are very contemporary with tasteful artworks and soft linen in the bathrooms. The night activity within the hotel adds to the quality they offer. Breakfast was extensive both local and continental and the waiters we always at hand to help you.

The company I work for paid for my two nights stay at the hotel before i traveled  to Dubai for my honeymoon in March 2014 There were no red roses on the bed or complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate when my wife and I came in; I learned later on from my staff that four points was expressly told that we are a couple on our honeymoon but apparently they forgot to do anything about this very important detail. Room service took forever, the wi-fi is very fast and the rooms are clean with a nice bathroom. The gym is also well equipped with instructors to help you with any queries you have. I used one of the hotel's meeting room in March 2015 for a focus group discussion and it took forever for them to give my respondents their tea break.The lady in charge of my booking for the

The ambience of peace is what I call the coziness of the Four Points by Sheraton in Lekki, Lagos.  I have been there thrice and I felt at peace in lobby of the hotel, because of the welcoming atmosphere without fanfare. And the lobby smells nice too.

This has become my favored place to stay in Lagos. I've been three times this year. It's a lot cheaper than the intercontinental and wheat baker for example but a good enough quality experience.   The food in the restaurant is pretty good and the coffee good in the cafeteria. There is an outside deck bar on the second floor which does excellent charcoal grilled food - I like the fish and the suya and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a decent gym and spa too and the rooms are quite nice. I prefer the ones higher up and facing the Oriental and the expressway rather the lower down ones on the side with the bar deck.   It's not perfect but most of its issues could be easily solved. The room service can be a bit off. We got left twice without towels and they don't

Been there on February. The Reception staff is polite and professional. The room is very clean, with modern fourniture, no noise from outside. Personally i don't like the floor it looks cold, but i accept it is the best solution for Hotels in Africa. Bed and pillows very, very comfortable. The public areas are well maintained, you feel good and safe there, staff always carry a smile on their face which is quite good. I've tried the restaurant and both bars, and i can say you don't have many options from the menu, the staff is kind and food is ok but the service is a little slow. In my opinion you get what you need for a business trip. You have anything you may need inside, which is very important in Lagos. I'm sure i'll be back.

Review Title: Good business hotel, almost all friendly staff
Review Text: Stayed for the second time at the Four Points. As a business hotel, is has got what you need. When arriving late there's a possilbilty to have a nice small diner at the roof top bar and also for classy dining there is a restaurant in the hotel (which saves you a trip on the streets of Lagos).  The hotel is centrally located, has (mostly) friendly staff and is clean. The internet connection (complimentary) isn't very stable but that's pretty common in Nigeria.

I last visited here about one year ago. No doubt I enjoyed myself then as has always been the case. I have made many visits to this hotel and have utilised their facilities many times over. Their rooms are good and very spacious. Their panoramic lifts make life pleasurable. You can always have your buffet if you so desire at breakfast, lunch or dinner. Their food is good but fairly expensive. This is also applicable to their drinks; but you will never regret having had a meal or drink at this hotel. You may run into a little traffic especially if you are visiting the hotel after office hours; but once you beat pass the traffic and enter the hotel you are assured of having a good time. There are two specific segments of this hotel that would remain always on my mind: THE OFFICE

My stay at Four Points in Lagos was great. This was my first visit to Nigeria. I had heard thousands of horror stories none of which turned out to be true. The staff was great and assisted when needed. The room was spacious and comparable in price and size of hotels here in the US. I plan to return in a few months and look forward to staying at Four Points again.

I spent just one day as my trip was just a days trip.  Check in time was too long and the seats at the reception was fully occupied,  at that time we didn't know that we could sit at the bar/ dining so we sat at the empty seat and we're told to leave because it was reserved for loyalty customers.  WiFi was very poor as I could not log in at my room on the second floor.  The WiFi at the lobby could connect but this was also very poor.  Now to the good part.  The rooms were very comfortable,  spacious,  the bed was very soft.  When I got back to my room later in the evening I had complimentary apples and a hand written note from the manager.  This was so nice.  Basically apart from the bad WiFi which I think is a general problem in Nigeria the hotel is a place I would definitely
Review Text

I had 8 nights here in February / March. During this time I fell ill and whilst recovering asked for the room cleaning to be skipped for a day. In no time the manager arrived with medical staff to attend to me. Even some of the restaurant staff showed concern and kept enquiring about my recovery. Because of the illness I didn't try the pool, but it looked lovely. Business travel from this venue was convenient due to the centrality on Victoria Island. I have learned that in spite of all the stories, I experience the people of Lagos as being very caring.

Review Title: Very good but could improve a couple of things
Review Text: As always, my review here is based on rating this hotel against others in Nigeria. The Four Points is nice and clean with friendly staff. I am sure my room had even been recently refurbed.   The buffet is one of the better I have tried in Lagos and the bar is good for watching EPL football if that's your thing.   The staff are friendly and helpful but none of them knew about the option to get Emirates miles instead of SPG points, despite a big sign in reception!! Also the outside bar plays loud music until very late  so if you have a room on the wrong side of the hotel you will have your sleep disturbed. Even on the fifth floor it was still very loud! It's for this reason I can't give more than 3 stars for my visit.

I stayed here recently for about 8 days during a business trip to Lagos.  The room was very spacious and clean.  Live music on Friday and Saturday nights are a plus after a long day.  The gym is well-equipped.  The restaurant served buffet with local dishes which was nice.  Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel.

Stayed here for a couple of days before Christmas, wanted a place with easy access for the activities had planned for the family. (i.e. stage play at the Muson centre, cinema at the galleria, car racing at Getarena). Packaged deal came with breakfast which had a decent selection, but packing space can be a challenge and it is very nosy and busy outside. This is definitely not the place to go to relax from the hustle and bustle of Lagos, but its location is perfect and easy access to all the major business places. It's abit pricey but then hotels in Lagos usually are. Staff were courteous albeit too busy at times for the personalised feel.  Overall, stay was good and serve its purpose.

From check in my experience lacked the sharpness of a class establishment. Attitude friendly and helpful but effectiveness of service missing. Parts of the hotel needs a refresh .... Like most hotels in Lagos - would be OK if it cost 50% less!

Review Title: A Business Week in Four Points Lagos
Review Text: Went to Nigeria for a 5 days business trip and we got recommendations to stay at the Four Point Sheraton so we did.  Checking was pretty simple and quick, I really felt welcomed. The receptionists were smiling and the line moved pretty fast. When it was my turn the receptionist realized that I‚Äôm a SPG Gold member, so she insisted that I have to go and check-in at the SPG Gold dedicated desk.  The receptionist was extremely nice he tried his best to find me a smoking room and when he failed, he upgraded me to a smoking suite with a balcony, and a lagoon view.   Even though I was told this is a suite it is a very long room, not really a suite.  The room was spacious and comfortable with all amenities. This room had large windows that opened on a balcony looking over the lagoon

Review Title: Decent enough hotel and much better than other options
Review Text: I have stayed in the 4 points of 2 occasions now for business in Lagos and it is one of the better options if you want to stay in the VI or Ikoyi areas.  The rooftop terrace is a great place to relax in the evening and if you want to stay in the hotel for dinner the options here are great. The service can be slow with long waits for food and drink but that's usual all over Lagos so if you are in a rush let them know and follow up.  The rooms in the hotel are very large and comfortable with everything you need. The restaurant in the hotel is limited in mainly offering buffets and I have only eaten breakfast here which is ok.  The service at the hotel can be patchy with around 30% of my experiences good, 30% ok and 40% to be improved. This can be very slow and often the staff at

I am a lactating mom who has had to travel without my baby. I have travelled with a cooler so I can transport the breastmilk for my daughter. The fridge in hotel room is small and has no freezer so I asked the hotel to store the milk (tightly closed in the cooler I brought) in their freezer. They have refused to do it and the reasons they have given me do not make much sense. I am spending 3 nights which equates to 3/4 litres of milk that my baby can use that I now have to throw away. The hotel manager's reaction has been very inconsiderate. Traveling as a lactating mom is already tough and this experience does not make it better. Also, having checked in I have had to call them to fix my internet and the hot water. Please be considerate to the lactating mothers who travel Four

Review Title: Secon best hotel in Lagos, best in price.
Review Text: 4 points means 4 star but nothing less than 5 star. Good food, nice bbq on Office bar at 2nd floor terrace. Friendly staff, but you need to order at least 3 times before it comes, they simply forget (general service quality problem in Nigeria). I stayed over 3 months, they gave me a big room with balconie. The whole stay was pleasant.

Stayed at the Hotel on a business trip for one week in early February. Its nowhere near a 5 star rating, but is a standard business class hotel. I was disappointed with online booking through the Hotel website as I was billed at the same week day rate over the weekend. The check in staff were unhelpful in sorting out billing issues and I'm yet to be re-credited by the Hotel on my unused deposit. There is one main restaurant in the Hotel that serves a buffet only, while the two bars in the Hotel serve snack foods. The bars only open at 5 pm during week days. The cafe lounge in the main foyer is usually filled during the day with guests and visitors as there is no other cafe or bar open. Although the rooms are spacious and comfortable with all amenities, the bathrooms and toilets
Review Text

Review Title: glorious and wondrously made,home away from home.
Review Text: I had a great time, during my stay with my friends, starting from the cool.friendly,smiling and amazing staffs, from the entrance to the room I stayed in till my departure time, the hotel was captivating, and their buffet meals taste exactly how I wanted it, I will return to this hotel over and over again.

The hotel is new and rooms are fresh as compared to hotels such as EKO however the positives just end there.  The checkin was painfully long after a long flight and check out was even longer because they wanted to charge me for breakfast additionally for a room which had breakfast included.   The breakfast spread is very very small..however they do give an option for you to take the coffee in a take away cup which I really liked.  The car rental inside the hotel actually has nothing to do with the hotel somehow e.g you can not get the airport pick up bill added to your room but have to pay them separately.   The hotel does not really give you an option to check out late because apparently their system is programmed to charge for half day room rent if the stay goes beyond 1 PM

The hotel was really expensive but it was worth it. I would have given it 5 stars if not for the room cleaners that kept on coming late. its better than the oriental right across the street  1) Very Clean and neat, the sheets were amazing. 2)Bathroom was very nice and there is a nice bathrobe.  Cons 1) My partner kept on being harrassed at the door when she tried to come up to the room without a key, perhaps its their way of keeping easy ladies out 2)The housekeeping came late alot 3)very expensive restaurants and bars we walked out to eat

A courteous and friendly front office staff, rooms are decent and clean. It is located in the high brow Victoria island and therefore close to the heart of major businesses. The restaurant and the outdoor grill bar have very good variety of mouth watering cuisines.

Very expensive Hotel, but in Nigeria it's normal.. Good hotel with nice rooms. In a few years it will need a good refurbishing. Swimming pool is nice as well as the gym, newly equipped with Technogym machines. The general level of cleaness is ok, could be improved. What is really outstanding is the breakfast buffet and the dinner buffet especially when taken outside. Best food I had in West africa. Security is good and the staff is very polite, nice and care-taking. Internet speed is good. I would definetely recommend it.

The Four Points by Sheraton hotel is a decent, well run hotel along the Lekki Expressway in Lagos. One of a new set of hotel options available on the 'Island', the Four Points provides a really good option for accommodation in Lagos. Hotel rooms are expensive in Lagos and Four Points prices reflect the market rate. Well located for business on Victoria Island & Ikoyi, this hotel has nice rooms, decent facilities, a gym & spa, numerous restaurants and an al fresco terrace bar.

Good central location - close to business locations in Victoria Island. On one stay, had a nice lagoon view. Another time, the view was avoidable.  Friendly staff, good attitude.   Comfortable rooms. Breakfast has a wide spread and adequate, for all nationalities. Room service menu was rather limited, especially for vegetarian folks.  Had meals at all the four restaurants / lobby cafe and all met expectations. I quite liked the cafe at the lobby, with wooden furniture. Spent a lot of time there enjoying a quiet meal alone with free wifi access.

I was there for business for about two weeks. I experienced a lot of what is written about. Yes,, the lobby area has a "funk" but, What are you going to do, high heat, high humidity equals funk. I really struggled to give this 4 dots, because the hotel isn't consistent. Some days the service was great, some, less than great. I give no credence to people complaining about the music, it is a bar that plays music until 10 or so, get over it, read the reviews, and don't stay on that side! I could complain about the power going out, but that isn't the hotel's doing. I could complain about the multiple security measures, but again, better safe than sorry. So, I found myself being an "ugly American" and that I try not to be. So, the hotel is clean, safe, really great service, with

Review Title: It does what it says on the tin... A nice enough hotel with a lively vibe
Review Text: I stayed here because my friends recommended it highly. First impressions- the foyer has a certain odour of damp and stale food. The decor is tired and worn. The air conditioning did not get very cool. The mattress was comfortable but the pillows less so. The view from our room was very nice. The buffet dinner was varied and delicious but dessert was  limited. Staff were helpful and courteous. I had a massage at the Spa and that was very good.

I have been to Fourpoints a couple of times and the service is nothing to write home about. The last time I went there, I made an order with one waiter and apparently that was just it. I waited for over 30 minutes before I had to ask another waiter about it and to my surprise it had not been placed at neither the kitchen or bar. I got my order after 45 minutes of arrival. On the upside they have delicious gizzards which come with dodo(plantain)  They also have had bands playing on all the nights I was there.
Review Text

Review Title: Ok to stay you may have better choices around...
Review Text: This was my first visit to Lagos and my stay was not all that good, but could have been better from Four Points by Sheraton. Most of the staff are not so friendly, while few really go out of their way to help.   Something good is always expected from Four Points by Sheraton, it failed to impress on the this occasion  - The way the front desk was handling guests was not so friendly and very haphazard. Pathetic is the word to describe the way the waitress used to treat the guests, looked like these people were doing a favour by serving the guests.  The bathroom - The water in the bath was very murky, got it repaired after repeated requests. The internet connection is really bad, i dont know if this is the case in other properties too.  Something good about the hotel was the

Firstly let me point out that I am a SPG Platinum Preferred Guest and stayed here using my points as the hotel looked as if it had everything I would need for me and my family. The good points were that the hotel staff in general were friendly and helpful most of the time, security is good, the rooms (7th floor) were of a good size and well appointed with comfortable beds. We had joining rooms with good bathrooms. If choosing a room ask for one over looking the river as ours were over the car park - not a nice view! Bad points: The swimming pool is not child friendly as the shallow end is 4'2" which is too deep for most children and the water was COLD - VERY COLD!! The pool area does not look like the picture on the website as there are no easy chairs, the bar area next to the

carbonized. then The access to the terrace bar as been forbidden to my daughter but no sign say so , was not informed at reservation of restriction are for kid..still no management. I went to reception staff told me they were not informed of this so did the night manager who I asked to go to check  . I am still waiting to hear from the General Manager of this local second class hotel but this person must be away from the hotel. Staff forbidden me to take pictures . I understand them!!! IF you are GM of this place you fail to get communication in your staffing, to have a minimum service at the brasserie, I was sold French dinner then as I complain we took me to the extension to discover it was close!!! then to get that the French dinner will be next day. Please leave this

I have been staying in Four Points since 2011 and would never change to any other hotel in Lagos. For me Four Points is no longer a hotel, it is ‚ÄúHome‚Äù. Located in VI, the hotel has a convenient access to major highways hence to the airport though you can not escape the traffic in any business day. The minute I enter the hotel, I feel the stress of the over crowded Lagos disappears. The welcoming attitude and the way the team surrounds me with genuine care makes me feel I am among my family members rather than in a hotel. The check-in process is relatively very fast compared to other hotels and usually the team remembers the guest preferences so you don‚Äôt need to spend much time explaining. The rooms are spacious, very well decorated and very well maintained.  The bed is the

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel for a number of reasons: The staff was soooo courteous and helpful, never once did I feel they did not want to meet my needs. The room was spacious, airy and clean. Even security at the gate was very friendly to us. We plan to come back in March next year and we will definitely be staying at this hotel. Great experience, worth the money.

Whilst the rooms and food were of a good standard, service was quite poor for a Sheraton hotel.   I was particularly upset that they failed to arrange my airport transfer. As a woman travelling alone in Lagos I like to arrange transport to where I'm staying. Upon arrival at the hotel (after having to take any old taxi from the airport) they offered no apologies. In my opinion they should have offered some kind of compensation but instead, upon asking them to provide me cash to pay the taxi driver and charge it to my room they said they were going to charge me 20% extra for the service. I had to kick up a fuss to get this charge revoked. Their excuse was that they used an external taxi company based at the hotel and it was their fault. For a business hotel of this 'standard' I

I stayed at this hotel during a trip with my family. At weekends there is a pleasant concert party in the hotel, we had fun there. The rooms and the services were of high quality, also the facilities were good except the pool that was out of service and the staff did not know about it.  Honestly was quite painful not to have the pool available during May, and not being informed.  I had also a small inconvenient while eating.  I would have rated the hotel higher if not for the pool and the eating inconvenient.

Review Title: Hotel doesnt live up to Four Point reputation
Review Text: This probably is one of the better hotels in Lagos. However the hotel falls short on a few basics. My bathroom sink was blocked and nobody seemed bothered enough to fix it. You wonder what else gets "brushed under the carpet" . Add to this a dodgy shower and slow service you start to wonder what you are paying for! Staff our friendly, nice vibrant bar with terrace on second floor and a clean swimming pool help. But why not open the pool bar / offer some pool service/ relaxing chairs then I may have forgiven the hotel for the earlier problems!

For N80,000 per night the least you expect is constant power and running water. Sadly, this hotel despite its modern decor and on the whole good service by personnel cant manage this.  This is the second time I stayed at this hotel an on both occasions there was several power cuts even if they were for just a few minutes. On the most recent stay the water supply stopped for almost half of the busy morning when guests are most likely to need water most!

Review Title: Friendly but not big on service
Review Text: Not a bad hotel but not big on the service end of things, especially in the dining room. Hands down the worst view I have ever experienced from a $300 + per night hotel . I overlooked the junkyard at the side of the hotel. Staff were friendly enough and the place was kept clean for the most part. I'm sure there has got to be better places in Lagos for the money.
Review Text

This is a well appointed hotel with a great ambience. Staff are courteous, professional and attentive.  In my opinion, the best value at a Four Seasons is the Lunch Buffet. It's easily the most popular business lunch destination in the environment with a wide selection of food and drinks, and very reasonably priced !  Finding parking space can be a challenge, especially during the lunch rush hour, so go with a driver, if possible or car pool, if in a group.

The hotel is well laid out in Lekki with in the best area of lagos and the palms shopping mall is just down the road . The rooms are large and fresh though the hotel has limited parking space but overall nice place to stay. Booking view Spg. Website also guarantee a better rate that walk in guest

I used to have lunch often but stopped due to the poor service and a very uninteresting buffet.....i decided to pop in for lunch on a saturday and see if it has got better...to my disappointment no one came around to take a drink order....non of my dirty plates on the table were taken away until i went and looked for a waiter to clear the table...the food was dry some dish said fillet but was not was a beef stew and had hardened on top...i could hardly find a dish for european taste buds and had to make due from a buffet were 99 percent was nigerian hot food. ...no body from the waiters to the chefs were interested in my problem they seem to have had to many of there own...ask for a manager i am still waiting...then asked for a supervisor took 20 minutes when he arrived he had

Review Title: The hotel to stay, while in Lagos.
Review Text: I was particularly worried about finding a hotel with good quality guest care so was wary choosing 4points, as the last time I was in Nigeria it wasn't yet built. My husband and I checked in the night of the 22nd of August, and I was immediately impressed with the appearance and more so with the room. Very spacious, nicely decorated, very clean, and well lit.  The bed is probably one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on and made getting up a real challenge, but happy to wake up feeling well rested indeed. The breakfast spread was very extensive, and it was very nice to see the local cuisine added as well. Although the price is not cheap at all, but I think very worth it.  Most importantly, I believe the staff make or break a place. For the most part, the staff were

Review Title: Four Points is ideal for business traveller
Review Text: The hotel is located in Victoria Island part of Lagos which is a well appointed address. I enjoy their food as they serve both local Nigerian and international cuisine. The breakfast at four points is very good and the check in and check out very fast.  The staff are very courteous and friendly.  The rooms are clean but avoid rooms facing the side where a live band plays music until around 11pm if you want to enjoy a quiete early night.

Excellent place,  amazing service, Yummy food, cost effective, Gym, pool, Spa, Lemo rent from the hotel (not taxi), what else?  Near to almost all tour visits. All food cuisines. In room dinner after 5 minutes, very friendly personnel, sound proof rooms, variation of rooms fit all needs, special offers and promos

Review Title: Best spot to get your Lady to say "Yes" to anything
Review Text: Mr. Collinx N.  My Lady couldn't stop smiling as we made our way into the hotel. Lodged into one of the rooms for the weekend........OMG!!!!!!! Breath taking! clean, smart  and Romantic.  The food was absolutely divine. It appealed to all my senses: beautifully plated, amazing aroma, and my taste buds were treated to a sensory overload. This restaurant had a romantic ambiance with the lull of the waves rolling in complimented by the pulsating music. If you are in  Lagos, you need to dine and lodge at Four Points. Now I seriously can not wait to hit the sheets over and over, again and again .

Every time I come here -- and I've had a few too many stays -- I have reason to be proud to be Nigerian again.  It's not just the ambience which, for a business hotel, is excellent: the rooms are modern and classy, and the rooftop bar is stunning. It's not just the food, which is consistently of high quality even if sometimes limited in range. It's not just the fitness center, where a sometimes overzealous, but effective, spinning-class instructor pushes you to attain your fitness goals. And it's not just the men and women who work here, who are always friendly and helpful, even if service in the rooftop restaurant is sometimes a little slow.  Together, it just works. Almost seamlessly.  This Four Points deserves a 5-point rating, but I reserve that for hotels that literally

The rooftop bar was the reason for my visit to this hotel and in fairness it did not disappoint. One of the cocktails did though but these things happen. The decor and the environment and clientele was at once bubbly and relaxing and my friends and I had a great time.

Wonderful friendly & truly helpful staff. Good rooms. Great ambience and food. Best for business and family. Good views. A bit expensive though. Good security. Cold room floors...need larger rugs. Awful showers.
Review Text

It was the evening of the last Friday of August 2014 to celebrate my birthday which was a day earlier. Getting up to the restaurant and roof lounge was unduly difficult. Asking for ID to go eat a meal is preposterous! The security on the restaurant landing kept dropping innuendoes suggesting he wanted a 'dash'. That's bad for the image of the hotel. The restaurant offered a buffet. Mixture of all sorts from Nigerian to foreign dishes. Good egusi soup. The Chapman was good.   The band on the open roof lounge was good but they didn't dress the part. And they looked a bit unmotivated. It had drizzled earlier maybe this dampened their spirits. Chairs and tables were wet. The drinks were outrageously expensive. We had a bottle of Hennesey VSOP costs almost 4 times the normal price.

First time at this hotel. Spent 3 nights. Staff were very friendly and professional. I was quite impressed with the security procedures in place at the hotel which includes using key card to operate the elevators. The Office bar is a must see. Very good atmosphere and surprisingly airy. The only down side of my stay was the shower. I expected have a proper bath tub.

Landed here when an out of town friend developed an acute crave for English Breakfast.   The buffet brunch had everything short of Tamil cuisines. Service was awesome and prices sort of agreeable.   The brunch is great for family especially those trying to avoid the after church cook out   I will definitely go back soon.

Stayed here for four nights to attend a two-day business meeting and a little dissapointed, primarilly with the limited range of food available. When limited to eating at the same venue 3 times a day this does become more important as the days go by! The faux French brasserie is French only in name and fittings so don't expect any improvements on Nigerian international buffet food here! Anonymous modern building, friendly staff and high prices are synomnomus with almost all business class hotels in Lagos and elsewhere in Nigeria though some have better locations by the waterside. Terrace-facing room quiet after the music stops at 10.30-11.00 (weekends only).

Review Title: My stay at 4 Points by Sheraton
Review Text: My stay was grand!!. This is my 2nd time of using the hotel and I have not had any reason to cancel or any regrets. Talk about facilities and good mannered staff, this is your choice hotel!!  The staff are always smiling and ever ready to listen and assist you in any shape or form.  Also the security at the hotel is great too. At the entry to the main lobby and at the lift entry, you can be assured of a tight security with cameras manned form the control room on all floors and the lift lobby. The meals at the 1st floor buffet was good, here you get excellent service from the ever smiling and attentive staff and supervisors. At the boutique and spa close to the restaurant, you can have your hair styled or shaved by experienced beauticians and some massages too!!!  On the ground

What a great pleasure to arrive at Four Points by Sheraton in Lagos, Nigeria after a long, six hour flight from Johannesburg, a three hour ordeal getting through immigration and customs and then a long and 'adventurous' taxi ride. The check in procedure and processes were quick and extremely professional and my colleague and I were overwhelmed by the friendliness of the staff.   The rooms at the Four Points are impeccably decorated and more than adequately provisioned for the business traveller. (Remember to bring your ‚ÄòFlat Three Pin , UK type electrical plug adaptor with you). Complimentary WiFi is a great feature but the bandwidth is limited and we found it to be frustratingly slow at times. The hotel is well positioned as a business / conference venue and the facilities are

Review Title: A good place to do business in Lagos
Review Text: Great rooms and support / reception staff. Very high quality of security including manning every floor from 7pm to 7am. Quality of service for restaurants is chancy. Small set of options on the menu. Room service takes inordinate time to deliver.  Experience more than made up by the amazing manager Ms. Moyyo. Extremely approachable and solved problems, most of them instantly. She was kind enough to let us make tea Indian style in the kitchen ourselves, something I never would have expected. Special mention for Tumnise, Ruth and Paulyn at reception.  Check in does take a tad long. Had an issue briefly with the wifi and I got an email today from the IT head apologizing as they were upgrading the routers. Would stay there again.

On victoria island, nearby most of the banks headquarters, the hotel offers a secured, well organised and confortable place to stay with good food, gym and spacious luminous rooms; shuttle to / from the airport is not automatic and shall be organised.

Review Title: One of the best in Lagos Nigeria
Review Text: I have visited this hotel 3 times, and mostly enjoy it.  Rooms are perfectly clean and modern, bathrooms as well.  Staff catering to the rooms are efficient and friendly, however, the waiters of the deck restaurant are just useless / lazy.  Waited for hours to be served and the prices of the food and drinks are quite ridiculous.  We left the hotel to go and eat at an outside restaurant. Check in also takes longer than what I think it should.  But other than that, it remains one of the better hotels in Lagos.

Review Title: Luxury hotel in the paradox city...
Review Text: Once you step in Nigeria, you would thought that all world's luxuries won't be available in Lagos. As a city of paradox, from one side you can see an amazing, brand new, luxury hotel and from another, African slumdog. Hotel has everything which every international 5* hotel should have an even more, but quite often you will be out of electricity (which is a reality in Nigeria). Also, don't be surprised with all armed security on the floors, in front of your room and even on the pool :) Great club on 3rd floor with amazing Nigerian music! Staff and people are simply amazing and that was my biggest impression from my Nigerian adventure!
Review Text

During the course of the past year I stayed in this hotel for 8 weeks (5 or 6 trips). It's very clean, the staff (waiters, security, reception) are very friendly and most importantly: The beds are perfect. The food in the restaurants is very nice. Try the chicken suya on the terrace or the chili burger in the bar. If you need a quick bite before you're on the road: Try the meat pie from the lobby-cafeteria. Breakfast buffet with it's Italian prosciutto and Salami can also be highly recommended. Never tested the pool or the gym though. However if my coworkers can be trusted everything's fine there. Would stay there again. If I ever visit Lagos again I know where I'll have myself a cold Star and a chili burger.

Review Title: As good as you can expect in Lagos.
Review Text: Safe and secure, the rooms are large and quiet.  Stayed there multiple times.  Got electrocuted by loose wires in the closet.  The light fixture was defective, but the hotel was not concerned.  Luckily it just got my attention and not much more....... Food is good and the staff is friendly.

Not the first time I have stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton in Lagos and probably not the last time either. The food is reasonable, the rooms large, clean and well appointed, the staff are very friendly and do whatever they can to help. Downsides are the price, which are expensive by London or New York standards and the lack of parking. Although absolutely not the responsibility of the hotel, its position means long waist around rush hour to get to or from anywhere due to traffic.

Just returned from a business trip to Lagos and stayed at the Four Point for two nights. The hotel as a whole was very good and the rooms were clean and spacious - as to be expected in a Four Point.  The friendly staff were certainly a welcome sight after the trials of Lagos immigration...

Review Title: Four stars... but there are little things that miss
Review Text: All in all, the ratio price/quality, is good, but...I will start with the minuses: - the rooms (at lesst the one I stayed in) had hone, instead of parquet or carpet. Typicall for Africa, but at least I was expecting to have slippers, but no... in a 4* hotel... - no hair dryer - the 'Capucinno Brasserie'  has a limited set of choices (only burgers) and relatively expensive! - veery epensive breakfast, if not included in the prices! And the breakfast is at it best, average!  Pros: - free internet - big rooms - good location in Victoria Island - nice lounge  Despite the minuses, I will problably return!

I am just back from Nigeria where I got married.  We stayed at the Four Points for the first time as guests even though we had visited the Adrenaline Bar and Roof Top on previous occassions'.  The hotel is very central to the best restaurants and shops, including Shoprite shopping centre; on Victoria Island.  Its is worth the high price you pay to stay, just because it's very clean, modern and the staff are professional and very welcoming.  There are a lot of things to do here, especially if you go by Lagos standards, the swimming pool is very nice and a welcome way to cool down from the Nigerian heat.  Various musical evenings' are held and I especially love the live band with it's lead singer who sings' brilliantly.  The atmosphere at this hotel is busy but calm, most people

Stayed here because of a work trip. Overall comfortable, service was ok if not fantastic (had to wait at reception). Found the bar incredibly smoky and was a bit annoyed to be charged non-happy hour prices even though we ordered during happy hour. Pool and gym had good facilities. Overall felt safe and secure at the hotel.

Review Title: A place to chill from the hustle & bustle of the city
Review Text: this isnt the first itme I have stayed at the hotel, however there were considerable improvements in it that I noticed from the moment I arrived.  The reception area hasnt changed, however the staff seem happier and more welcoming, even the guards at the gate always said hi and welcome.   Being a SPG gold member I was given a room on the 8th floor, the rooms are almost identical to the other floor sbut its considered the premium area. Review Title: Good facilities, poor service, Way overpriced (as evrything in Lagos)
Review Text: By Lagos standards a modern, well-equipped hotel with decent rooms that have all the equipment you need. Gym is fine, small pool, overpriced spa (tip- go to Montaigne Spa only 5 minutes away if you want normal prices). So facilities overall are fine.  Problem is the totally incapabable and slow staff. Saying they are as slow as a snail would be an insult to any snail. Order a club sandwich-expect at least 1 hr. Order Dinner in the office restaurant on 2nd floor - calculate for 1.5 hours. Lobby coffe bar - same issue. Also staff will mix-up, forget, not show-up for 20 minutes anymore, need to find them to settle your bill etc. Laundry claims pick-up by 9 am and back by 18:00 - typically you have to push to get it back 3 days later after 18:00. So a lot of unfulfilled promises.

Review Title: Friendly, comfortable, clean, above my expectations
Review Text: Stayed for three nights march 2014. From the time one arrives to check-out, very friendly staff. My room a double standard, was nicely sized, and immaculately clean. The deck bar on the 2nd floor, supplied drinks and light snacks as well as live music, all adding to the great experience. The hotel is tight on security, reassuring any traveler who has concerns regarding security. All the public areas add to the overall comfort making this  a perfect business stop.  Breakfast was tasty with a big selection of welcome dishes for those liking a big first meal of the day. Only down side is the prices are steep, bus as this was my first visit to Lagos, I have nothing to compare to so perhaps they are par for course. Will recomend for any business trip...

By far the best hotel that I stayed at in Nigeria. Clean, new and very comfortable. I stayed over a weekend also and could just relax and chill out very comfortably.  The food was good, the service was good, the room was clean and very comfortable.  I used the gym and that was also good.  I would easily recommend anyone wanting to stay to choose this hotel. I stayed at this hotel in January and I must say that Lagos Nigeria has stepped up!!  this by far is the best hotel I have stayed at.  If you find yourself in Nigeria, please visit and stay at the hotel. The breakfast is awesome.  Loved the rooms!! I cant wait to go back

Review Text: Having stayed a couple of times in the other Sheraton, I gave the four points a go last time. It's a better option of the two although still fearsomely expensive.  The hotel is a relatively new build so interior facilities are in good shape. Rooms are of a decent standard although the wifi is a bit sketchy at times and as always in Lagos, there are power outages at random times.  The outdoor terrace bar is fine - no real view to speak of but it's a pleasant enough environment.   Major downside is the distance from the airport - it's fine if you need to be on Victoria Island but if not the trip into town or back to the airport can be take forever.

Review Title: Best Hotel I've Stayed in Lagos
Review Text: From the time I walked in till I left. The service was wonderful, friendly staff and guests. I went with my husband and baby. The only hitch however was the faulty smoke alarm besides that my stay was great.

Review Text: Although not spectacular, this hotel is a good option for business in Lagos. It is cookie cutter US style though, so not for the adventurous or those looking for a bit more character.

Having been away from Nigeria, and living in Uk where Shops or Restaurants are not open on Christmas Day; It was a WoW factor for me. People, Families from all race were all out for the buffet. There were lots of foods on display, which also tasted very well and at relatively cheap price. Organisation was Fab! Food were replenished ASAP as it was running out. Atmosphere was warm and homely. A foreign traveller will feel safe here and I would recommend it.

During my stay at a newer very clean property, I experienced friendly staff and excellent food.  The only negative was the location - a long cab ride from the airport and a neighborhood you would not want to walk around.

Four Points is located at a very nice place, safe location.   Nearby areas are also quite decent & attractive.  The hotel is beautiful and the staff are courteous.  Rooms were neat & clean, nice design & elegant furniture.  Feels soothing & comfortable to stay.  Will definitely consider to stay again & recommend to others for their stay in Lagos.

I loved it here. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are courteous. They have a really good buffet on the weekends. It is in a safe enviroment. I felt like I was in the US when I was in this hotel. I plan to stay at this hotel this January when I return back to nigeria.

Review Title: Great place in a very 3rd world country
Review Text: Lagos is a difficult city to appreciate. It is congested, polluted. Crime ridden. The list goes on. But there are some positives, and this hotel is one. First off, the staff is very friendly. The hotel is clean. The rooms are spacious. The food is good at the restaurants.and they do take security seriously. The Internet wi-if can be hit or miss, but they do try to fix it if its not working. The power goes out repeatedly, but they have back up generators that come on with seconds. The water is sometimes brown and sometimes cold, but that too is usually a very short term concern. Most,of the problems that you might encounter here are based more so on the lack of infrastructure within the country vs. a problem with the property itself.

Review Title: Pretty good but the Radisson looks better
Review Text: Stayed here for three nights with work. A vast improvement on the mainland hotels which are all a little tired. Functional and clean with rooms well insulated from the Lagos noise. Location great and staff attentive (Lagos is getting much better at service). They've managed to install some of the slowest lifts made making shuffling from conference area to your room painful. Wifi predictably unreliable and the bar area is a little industrial but at least outside. The deck at the Radisson in comparison is a destination! Happy to come back but only on business. Island however = bridge traffic so leave plenty of time to get to the airport.

I stayed at this hotel with a team from our donors and employers from the US as well as in Nigeria for a few days on a business trip. From reservation to check in things went smoothly....too smooth I was a bit uneasy! The rooms are quiet, the view beautiful and the area itself is safe and secure allowing one to take a walk upto the lagoon or other body of water nearby. Internet works perfectly another business  I fell in love with the snacks they serve, fresh, tasty and succulent pies and freshly made fruit smoothies to accompany such offerings. Though the meals are on the pricey side, the taste and quality compensates for it.  The beds are really good and provide for deep sleep!  I recommend this hotel for any business trip to Lagos Nigeria and also for the discerning traveller

Lagos has improved tremendously in every sense of it, security is at it's best and tourist can safely visit Lagos, i am sure they will be glad they did.
