Review Title: A good place to come back to after a tiring day
Review Text: I spent almost a week there for business in July. The standard of service was excellent. Once you get used to the frequent power cuts and infrequent internet service (that's more a Nigerian problem and not the hotel's fault), you're left with a very friendly staff, large room, comfortable bed and adequate meals. I was glad to get back there in the evening to rest from rushing around Lagos through the never ending traffic jams. Also it was relatively close to business area.

I liked the overall ambience but I didn't get around the hotel that much. The dining area looked like it needed some restyling. I didn't care for the European cuisine in the buffet restaurant but I loved the Nigerian food offered there. The periodic power cuts were a bit unsettling. I didn't see any evidence of people getting stuck in the lifts.The staff were very polite and did their best to help. I was a bit surprised that there were no helpful tourist maps of the vicinity anywhere. I was a bit upset that most of the cable TV stations were not working during my stay. How can any one survive without CNN and ChannelsTV?  I would use the hotel again on a return visit but I will certainly phone ahead to check that wifi and cable tv are working.

As a frequent traveller to Lagos I've found the Sheraton to be the best overall. The staff is extremely accommodating as I especially a follow up call once I've made a request (very impressive) that's indicative the employees truly want a satisfied customer. John, one of the managers of the hotel is a Great asset. I have to also give kudos to Isaac (the IT tech who always manages to keep me connected).  Nothing but Praise for John and the Four Points in Lagos.

A newish hotel that suffers the usual problems of being overpriced and under serviced by the staff. Check in is an okay process although the staff here do vary considerably as well. However whatever their faults they pale into insignificance compared to the waiting staff in the bar( smoke filled) and the foyer coffee shop. It can take an age to served despite waving frantically and when they do notice you and amble over the service and attitude can be wondrous!!! As with many African hotels they abuse the guests with over priced food and poor service and a very limited unchanging uninspiring menu. If you do have to stay here be sure to get out and about to some of the local ex-pat bars, if you don't you will despair.

This is really a gr8 place to stay, located in a safe place in Lagos with management and staff so ready help. Travelled on business, and through the stay, had a gr8 experience with friends and coleagues. will always want to come back each time am in Lagos or Nigeria.

This hotel is very good for business travellers. Stelayed there for a week and enjoyed it very much. Breakfast buffet with parma ham was a nice gesture. Pool seems to be ok, did not have time to use it though. Will stay there again.

Review Title: One of the more functional and efficient business hotels in Lagos
Review Text: We stayed in Four Points as part of our new year holiday. Mistake. The hotel does not have much to offer families by way of holiday diversion. So you must treat this as a strictly business hotel - in this, they come up looking pretty good. Service not spectacular, looks understaffed, cramped rooftop bar with poorly-trained, overworked waiters; but the food, as is the tradition with Sheraton was excellent. The rooms were also sparkling - but it really is a Spartan, if elegant hotel. But nothing stands out in the memory to warrant a repeat leisure stay, but I would put my business visitors here without hesitation. Not a vacation destination.

Review Title: Top of the line for Nigeria
Review Text: Secure hotels are few & far between in Lagos, thus you will pay a premium to stay here.  We chose this hotel on recommendations made by our Security Team. Reservations: Made them through the Starwood 800 number.  Requested a conference room & a menu, and was told the hotel would contact me directly.  I received an email from the hotel telling me the conference room was 70,000 NGN [about $450 USD] per day.  After some negotiation they offered 50,000 NGN.  I asked to reserve it for three days, and never received any confirmation.  I also asked for a menu in every email exchange.  That request was never even acknowledged.  Some of my associates were arriving before me and the hotel required a credit card pre-authorization for each room and each type of charge [food, etc.]  Took a

The hotel is really poor, the food is not good at all, nothing to do in there except just sitting in the lobby with a friend. The SPA and Gym are not good as well, so you won't enjoy them, but you have to exercise anyway to waste your time and get healthy. The surrounding area is extremely poor and I won't recommend anyone to get out of the hotel on foot specially at night.

I'm a frequent traveler to Lagos, the best moment after coming back from a long day of work and long traffic is to reach the Hotel, the staff are very friendly, available and caring, the management team are very accessible and they do whatever possible to make my stay enjoyable, the rooms are clean, there some rooms that I personnaly dont like, eventhough they are big ;-) cause they are noisy and some have less wireless coverage on the high floors at the edge of the corridors, central rooms are the best. There is always live music ending at 10:30 at the roof top bar which varies every day, from time to time they bring amazing singers or musiciens, but overall diverse.  The Spa is amazing with a very perofesional asian therapists, even though I found the massage price a bit

The location is not too bad , price  of $500 to $600 a night without breakfast is way over priced . Security is the best for preferred customers and executives . Food is excellent , rooms are very clean . They should provide adapters for foreign phones as standards in all rooms . Customer service is great . Their location in IKaja need serious update the rugs smells like pee . All and all not a bad place to stay

This is my first time at this hotel. On the face of it, lobby, rooms etc., the hotel is attractive. Front desk was understaffed, my agent booked me $ 280 pd - excludes $30 breakfast? Now in for $310. I had to pay $800 deposit for 2 nights, wow. Price includes free Internet that is designed to log you off every 45 minutes, so you have to keep logging in. You can buy a better Internet plan, but I refuse to pay for internet at a hotel. Finally get a room that smelled like a cigar lounge. Apologies were offered amd accepted and I was given a new room. Nice room. Internet was up and down like a yo-yo, almost as unstable as the electricity. Power went off 3 times in the last 5 hours. Called to have dinner sent up..no answer...engaged..no answer...customer service...no

A hotel that is not in line with Sheraton expectations  During my stay the electricity was cutting all the time  The quality of the breakfast is bad  The team is under qualified to book and for the check out it's a long story  Please remove this hotel from your list of hotel this will be a good choice :-)
Review Text

a very good hotel with great conference facilities .... rooms are nice... restaurant serves a good variety of food.. staff is very friendly and helpful.  There is an outside bar/terrace which is beautiful to sit during the evenings... nice music playing while you enjoy the evening breeze.  Pay attention to your bills though, on the day i was checking out a guy from the restaurant came running to me asking that i pay for breakfast separately since I'd already checked out, i almost handed him a $50 bill when i realized that my accommodation was B&B which means breakfast that morning was included in overnight charges!   be careful.. it's Nigeria after all! :))

It was indeed a good first impression by the hotel front desk staff who made my business associates visiting Nigeria for the first time feel welcome after a long flight. She made the checking in process seem like breeze for them. Unexpectedly, while waiting for their turn to check in, a staff Shola brought complementary cold glasses of juice for us and all the other guests waiting to check in. It was timely and a good way to say welcome to guests after a long and exhaustive trip no matter how insignificant it might seem. Good impression and do keep it up.

i don't actually know other hotels in town but anyway the four points turned out to be a great choice for a very tough working week in Lagos. the position is central for a standard oil&gas meetings agenda, the rooms are large, clean and furniture is new and nice. the view is not the best being Lagos... Lagos but you can see the ocean or the lagoon which is not bad anyway. there is a nice sport bar and top roof bar, personal is nice and warm and even pretty fast for the local standards. wifi internet in room is weak if there is any, but this seems to be more a 4 points problem since also in houston i have had the same problem.

Review Title: Best hotel in VI - Clean and reasonably priced
Review Text: If you are working in VI or Lekki this is the place to be.  Only a few years old.  Large rooms with god AC - free wireless and big comfy beds.  Good gated security and a very relaxed lobby area with a nice coffee shop that does sit in or takeaway.  The outside bar/terrace is a lovely place to sit in the evenings but the food is not great!  The price by Lagos standards is actually pretty reasonable!

Review Title: Good hotel that cant seem to manage the demand... Expected more for the price
Review Text: Stayed here long term for business so had a chance to feel things out.  Would I come back? Only to keep my SPG status and for the distance between the hotel and my office.  Pros: Some of the staff are very attentive and give fantastic service... Above the standards of four points which was nice.  Pros: The suites are pretty decent sized, four bottles of water daily, nice bed, nice balcony... No complaints here.  Cons: Good  luck getting a coffee at breakfast.  Started just going up to the machine and making my own. Also... No Takeaway cups unless  so that you need to go downstairs and pay $5 for a cup of mediocre coffee  Cons: internet setup is horrendous.  You need to keep signing in every few minutes... On various devices, same thing.  Called them a few times to no avail.

I've stayed at a number of Four Points hotels but must admit I had some preconceived notions about what this one might be like given that it's in Lagos. Color me surprised. All though the food is only average at the hotels numerous restaurants, the service was friendly, accommodating and eager to help. The room was a great size, the bed was comfy and I found it to be a great value overall. Would definitely recommend it to anyone heading to Lagos.

Staff are quite friendly and service is average. I stayed in an executive room on the 8th floor and was surprised to find the bath tub patched up with some tape! Seems that there was a hole in the tub that got patched up. I didn't get the feeling that the bath tub was very clean and it should just be replaced. No bed room slippers provided. For the $450 per night paid for the room, I expected more. The room is spacious and comfortable. Wifi unbelievably slow and non-existent in the bar on the ground floor. I appreciated the 4 bottles of water provided in the room daily. Be prepared to put up with all the smokers when visiting the sports bar on the ground floor; no smokers section.

Review Title: Workshop at Four Points by Sheraton
Review Text: It was a pleasant experience, the food is simply amazing and tasty, the staff were courteous and ready to help. I sure did have a nice time, especially with the variety of teas during the coffee break. I would visit over and over again

In Lagos this is as good as it gets for now.  This is a land of growth and opportunity and this is a place to pause in the chaos and has good security, service, and accommodation. Coffee in the AM downstairs is good, sitting outside upstairs on the lobby roof at night is a nice place for a lounge to relax and have a drink or quick bite, the resturant serves a great breakfast.   But beware before coming it is clearly posted at the front desk that " money laundering transactions are prohibited by the management".......in plain English.  You have to smile, it is Nigeria after all.

Recntly stayed here for a week on business.  Overall quite an enjoyable experience. I found the room to be quite large and well appointed. WIFI was quite fast.  Onl√©y minor downsides I found were the poor quality towels and smoking in the hotel bar (yuck!). I can't complain about the views over the shanty town - it's hardly under the control of the hotel.  Location is ideal for VI & Lekki.   Breakfast and dinner in the 1st floor restaurant were buffets of a reasonable quality.
Review Text

Review Title: Correct but expensive. Lagos needs hotels!!!
Review Text: It is a brand new hotel that due to the maintennance and the use will be old within no more than two or three years. Rooms are big, well ecquiped, the bathroom is may be the weak point but today is ok if you visit Lagos for business.

I have had the pleasure of staying in this welcoming hotel on a number of occasions for both long and short stays and I can honestly say that I have never been let down.  The location is ideally situated (for VI and Lekki), the Guards and Staff are always polite and respectful and the food in the main restaurant and on the Ground floor is of a good quality. The level of customer service is also exceptionally high. The rooms are always clean, spacious and well appointed, and the pool/gym and spa are all of a high standard.  This is certainly my hotel of choice within Lagos - the only negative would be if you have a room overlooking the terrace bar, as it can get a little noisy with music. However, the staff were happy to move me.

Lagos has been waiting for some good business hotels and 4 points has pathed this gap. The location is very good as both the Vitoria Island as well as Lekki peninsula are at aprochable distance. The service is Good and the open air lounge is awesome.

This has every prospect of being a superb 4/5 star hotel in a challenging environment. The reception staff are very welcoming and helpful as is everyone else I have met and the security seems very good. However.... There is not one single piece of documentation in the room regarding facilities, restaurants etc or how to set the alarm clock, let alone any notepaper. The room is lovely but one morning there was no hot water and the next there was no shampoo and reduced numbers of bottles of water. Both quickly rectified but ...... The TV seems to work ok but do not hope that the channel guide under the glass on the credenza bears any resemblance to the actuality. Wifi very good. Does anyone here know how to clean stainless steel (as in the lift doors). The gym is really well

The hotel is well located and has a fantastic design with attractive interior decor. The reception staff gave a very superb performance. We had plenty to keep  us busy and fun filled for the new year stay. The only but is the 3pm check in which is on the late side.

Comfortable hotel. The rooms are spacious and well ventilated. Goog courteous staff. The breakfast menu is very good. A variety of food choices are available. The Adrenalin bar is very good for hanging out. The hotel is at a good location on Victoria Island not far from the Palms Mall, Genesis Cinema and the GET Arena... Rooms facing the high-way may experience some traffic noise but all in all, I enjoyed my stay.

Review Title: Good proximity to Victoria Island and Ikoyi
Review Text: The service was great from booking till we stepped out of the hotel to our home.  The staff were very supportive, clarifying gray areas.  Our room was promptly made each time we left for more than an hour.  The food remained consistent in taste and variety.  I had another occasion to be a part of a daylong strategy session in the Four Points. The food was really tasty for a hotel of that size.  From my experience most 3 and 4 star hotels don't live upto the billing when it comes to food. But Four Points Lagos is an exception.  I will recommend this hotel to holiday makers who want to stay close to restaurants and interesting places on Lagos island.  Also for business visitors who want to be close to Offices in VI and Ikoyi, but stay removed from the centre of official activities

Review Title: Good for Lagos, could easily be better though
Review Text: This is Lagos, so managing to deliver something average for an exorbitant price is actually a the norm.  My rating means it's a very good hotel for Lagos, not that it's a very good hotel I would choose to stay in if I had the choice.  The Four Points does very well when it comes to staff (helpful and friendly, possessing common sense), food and drink (a good sports bar, outdoor bar and buffet restaurant), room service (prompt, good choice) and location (near to wherever I tend to need to go).  There are also no 'overly friendly' ladies hanging around bothering you, which makes a nice change.  Security staff are very conscientious . One evening my door was not closed properly and staff called me within minutes to inform me and check everything was ok.  Rooms have coffee and tea

I have just returned from a longer than usual stay at this hotel.    While I agree that the wait time for checking-in could be improved (perhaps the hotel could utilise the guest relations desk as overflow during peak check in?), I found other comments difficult to reconcile with my experience.  I found every member of staff in the hotel (from the check-in staff to the security staff) to be polite, friendly (without being over-bearing), and attentive.  Unlike a competitor's check-in staff down the road, the staff at this hotel are far more friendly and do not give the impression that they are doing you a favour at the check-in desk.  The rooms were nice, and the beds comfortable.  I also personally like the shade of the furnishing as it is not brash and in your face.  However,

Review Title: Very bad hotel - so sorry I stayed here
Review Text: If I could do my whole life over....  Pros: None  Cons:  1) 2 hours from the Lagos International airport (I kid you not due to highway construction) 2) Service is horrendous - I waited 1 hour for them to process me and 1 hour for them to bring my bags 3) Rooms are horrible (too cold or too hot) 4) Rate is way too high (they know they're the only game in town, but they're not)  You've been warned. Don't be fooled like I was.
Review Text

Bear in mind the hotel is going through external renovation. at least half of the hotel rooms have scafolding out of the window. apart from that food, service and the rest is just fine but very expensive

Review Title: Very average hotel. Probably good by Lagos standards
Review Text: For a new hotel, this place does not look great. The finishes are terrible, and tiles are chipped all over the place. The A/C sounds like a Boeing 747 flying through the room. Water from the taps looks like water I would flush down the toilet, and the check in process is diabolical. I am a Starwood Gold member, and tok over 40 minutes to check in, so when people comment about service being a bit slow it is an understatement.  Having said all of this, the hotel has a reasonable restaurant where you can eat the food......a major plus point for Nigeria. Prices for meals at the hotel are horrendous, but this is to be expected in Lagos for edible food. Staff are generally friendly, but not efficient.would I stay here again? Yes, as this hotel is decent by Nigerian standards and

Have now racked up many many weeks staying here and having tried all the hotels in Lagos at some point this one wins hands down on the service - really very well trained, friendly, and some nice personal touches.  Rooms are simple and room service menu a bit limited - but the terrace bar is very pleasant, and the Brazzerie restaurant pretty good.  The innovation of the coffee bar is great too.  A big thankyou to the staff for making me feel very welcome.

Stayed here for two nights like it a lot, check in a bit slow I get free coffee and very friendly staff make the waiting a bit ok . After traveling10 days around the country from Lagos-Calabar-Abuja and back to Lagos visiting relatives and friends staying in different hotels it feels so good to experience a hotel worth what you paid. Room is tidy and clean, the shower is nice even few little things in the bathroom need more attention, amenities good. Enjoy it a lot with relatives & friends sitting every night at the 'The Office Bar Terrace' great Atmosphere nice music, microphone and sounds system need an up grade. The Lobby area are very nice for meeting friends with a good coffee and croissant. Good Hotel Location. Staff and security are very friendly, polite and professional

Review Title: Courteous Staff, Good food , Centrally located
Review Text: This was my second business trip to Lagos and I had previously stayed at the Radisson Blu. I enjoyed the week i spent at the Sheraton  and found the hotel to be clean, modern and safe ( they have security on every floor in the evenings) The views are not that great as you will either find yourself facing the main road or a highway. I found that the power cuts were more frequent this time round ( apparently this is worse when it rains) The food was above average with a variety of dishes available each night. The entertainment at the bar on the second floor could be a little annoying sometimes and the service was a bit slow. However the Giant grilled shrimp and chicken wings were a hit with our party. I had to hire a driver for the week that i was there and i found the  taxi/car

Review Title: Shall I say what we pay what we get?
Review Text: Company business brought me to this place. First time ever. Friendly people at the hotel. There're local & American food at the buffet breakfast & lots of bakery at the cafe. Nice bang at night time tat outdoor atmosphere. Decent food. Of course they're not cheap. But a nice stay.

Review Title: Your paying "W" prices for Four Points quality
Review Text: I stayed here for a total of three nights and enjoyed my time here.  The staff are very friendly and upgraded me to a suite each night of my stay.  The prices are extremely expensive but I suppose that is what you should expect when visiting Nigeria.  The room service was okay.  They mixed up my order but I was so hungry that I didn't complain about it.  The hotel did not take AMEX so make sure you have a VISA or MASTERCARD to pay your bill with.  What I liked best is that the internet connection was fast and reliable.

Review Title: Good restaurant, sports bar and gym
Review Text: Not bad the hotel, the interior of the rooms are very similar to southern sun in ikoy, some few miles away. The gym is big and offers beside new equipment also spinning classes, which are also good. The sportsbar should be non smoking, but it is a much nicer place than other sport bars in Lagos. On the terrace bar you can sit and chill out at night... Breakfast can be better for its price of about 30-40‚Ç¨, because after some days you get bored by the offered choices. There should be more fruits or cereals and maybe dark bread. If you get an upgraded room it is huge, if not then a bit too small and the carpet stinks a bit from chemicals. I would stay there again.

stayed here on a few occassions, room was good, clean and comfortable, restaurant good especially their buffet lunches, and dinners. ample amounts of freshly cooked food piping hot, friendly staff, good location, vewry busy lounge bars with ex patriots.

The hotel was good with large clean rooms. However it was expensive. Breakfast was not included and was an additional $30. The views from the rooms are not pleasant. The bar and the lounge were functional. The breakfast was good with reasonable service
Review Text

By international standards, Lagos hotels are very expensive for what you get. This hotel is well appointed with a number of places to eat and drink which is good as there is nothing that I could see within striking range of the hotel. There was a buffet and bar food so not a great selection. My room was clean and adequate and for a business traveller, the free wifi was a big plus, there is, however, no business centre although the front desk will print out small docs if you ask nicely! Security was good with guards at the gate, foyer and on the floors. The Reception desk was VERY helpful and friendly. No report is complete without mention of the Spa which was top class and priced reasonably. I'd definitely stay there again.

Review Title: Good Lagos hotel if a bit out of city centre
Review Text: Good quality accomodation, nice roof top bar and sports bar.  Rooms pretty good although as ever in Lagos expensive.  Food average - burgers, pizzas and a bit of local tucker is all you will get but it is adequate.  Good security also, on the gate and on the floors.

Once over the shock of hotel prices in Lagos, this hotel is quite good. The rooms are spacious and clean, although the decor and finishing is a bit tired. The surroundings are not very attractive, but then one isn't advised to walk around Lagos anyway.   The staff is very helpful and friendly.   One note of caution - as anywhere in Nigeria, cash is king/preferred. Amex was not accepted, so I used my debit card...  when I checked out the hotel owed me money but did not manage to credit it back to the card, and they refused to return dollars, so I ended by with local currency which I did not want :-(  Anyway, I would stay here again.

This hotel is located near the bay, however there is nothing outside the gate of the hotel. Very secluded sort of area. There is a mall 15 minute walk away, but nothing to write about.  Check in was great. The trouble started, when I enerted the room. The guys gave me a room, above the central generator and hence there was this constant humming sound in the room. I asked for a change and I got it, within 30 minutes.  The rooms are cool, but surprisingly not carpetted, this makes the floor very cool and one cannot walk barefoot. However the room was very clean and bed comfortable. The other problem is the view- make sure you, ask them for a view away from the open plot next door- where there are people, staying in shanties. One is greeted with unpleasent sights of nature, I hence

Review Title: very good place to stay in Lagos
Review Text: I stayed here just last week on business, I have arrived from Abuja, arranged for the hotel to pick me up (Naira 8,500) and made it safely to the hotel. On arrival, I was most impressed by the reception and the building....it was actually quiet nice.   Then the troubles started....only 1 of my 5 credit cards worked, the machines would not accept 4 cards issued by 4 different banks. The credit limit was not an issue. Then I found out the hotel does not have an ATM machine inside, I had to get money from the reception paying a 5% comission. Then I got the key to my room. Please keep in mind, the security guards advised me it was not safe to go outside the hotel to withdraw money from the ATMs. There is a large shopping mall near by.   The room was fantastic, just what I am used

Review Title: four points sheraton lagos,victoria island experience
Review Text: amazing service,first class view of the lagune,unbelivable rates and adorable cuisine,totaly unbelivable customer service,friendly atmosphere,clean and serene surroundings,fresh water side breeze,in a pristine environment,i almost thought i was in australia or cap town,i must heve passed on and gone back to my ase,since the hotel is a consecion similar to the one in Hull/ottawa,canada my home base.

Lovely hotel with all you need in there: Gym Spa Hairsalon Restaurant Bar/terrace... Favorite place is the bar on the second floor the staff is usually quite nice especially Christiana who has been working there for at least a year. Shes lovely polite and pro, always making our visits more pleasant. The rrstaurant has a wide range of food the buffet is good and fresh. Spa is great too. My only bad experience there was at the hairsalon, it was mu first and last time. The "hairdresser" did not do what i asked at all and when  i called up the manager to sort it out by at least giving me a discount she was very rude and condescendant.  Having said that, the hairsalon at the four points is not owned by the hotel...not up to standards.

I have stayed at Four Points for one week during a business trip. The rooms were spacious, clean and well furnished. Service was great and the staff is very friendly. The room service menu had very little varieties so was not very convenient. The restaurant is good , each day they had a different cuisine (seafood, latino and italian) as well as the local nigerian food.  I tried going to the hairdresser even there and it was very good but overpriced.  The swimming pool is not good as it is indoor and not spacious. The only thing that I didnt like in the hotel is that there was no many things to be done in term of activites but anyway this is normal in Lagos. The hotel doesn't have a good view either on the lagoon or the ocean, it can see the lagoon from a very small angle.

Four Points by Sheraton just like the other prominent Hotels, Abuja Sheraton, Eko Hotel & Suites, FPH, and so on is a place with an excellent ambience. You need to be there to see for yourself. It's an hotel that has hosted degrees of personalties. Good for presidents, ambassadors, business guru and the likes infact just hosted the former Nigeria president, Olusegun Obasanjo yesterday. See things for yourselves, be there...

Review Title: Nice rooms, great restaurant and good facilities but a few small touches would make it truly world class
Review Text: Stayed while on business for a couple of nights, I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Lagos now and this is quite reasonable in the room rates whilst still offering international standards. The restaurant and particularly the buffet were very passable. Couple of little bars outside and in depending on your preference both were fine. Only criticisms I would have was the usual staff being quite slow and uninterested to the point of being rude but I have come to expect this in Nigeria in general which is the only thing that reminds me where I am, but this is not the western world so you have to just accept it. Also the spa facilities whilst very good we're very overpriced in my opinion even by Nigerian standards. All in all definitely worth staying here as a cheaper alternative
Review Text

Lovely hotel with excellent service. I live in Lagos but was there on a retreat for 3 nights. The food was good. Facilities were functional. But what stood out for me was the service. Every complaint I had (there were a couple)was taken care of with dispatch. The staff were courteous and always ready to help. A few days after checking out, I realised that I'd lost my wallet and didn't know where exactly, I'd lost it. Having searched everywhere, I stopped by the hotel about 2 weeks later and housekeeping produced my wallet with everything intact! Infact, they had a register which stated the day it was found and I signed, stating the wallet has been returned.  Downsides: Room service always took forever and the menu is quite limited. It's also quite expensive   If you are looking

I stayed at the 4 points from the 22nd to the 27th of July, I booked in advance online and got a 30% prepaid discount, ( 42,000/ naira per night ) although the actual amount is only swiped when u arrive. Booked on the spg floor, got upgraded to the executive floor, speedy check in and check out always with a smile. Breakfast was good, the dinner buffet could have been better, if it's not for the traffic to the island I would recommend it.

The Four Points is good, but its expensive and far from the airport.  I like it for the rooms (although the air-conditioning is set too cold) and gym.  The food is not that good considering the price of the hotel.  The bar is too smoky (i.e. cancer ward).  Fine place if budget is not a concern.  Ibis Hotel Airport is much better value, especially if one is only in Lagos for one night and does not need to go to Victoria Island.

Stayed for four nights in two rooms with my wife and two boys. Could not get inter-connecting rooms, but was offered complimentary room upgrade; brilliant! The service is excellent and the staff are pleasant and always helpful... made us feel comfortable. Will stay in this hotel again the next time I visit Lagos.

Hotel on international standard with all necessary facilities, good location, good service, clean and nice staff. But as always in Nigeria: Price on the very high side! Room and food (breakfast, dinner) are quite expensive.

Review Title: Nice Rooms, Good Seafood At the Restaurant
Review Text: Stayed here for a weekend get a away with my wife.  Nice, clean rooms adequately furnished. Good staff.  Had nice seafood at the restaurant, it was a seafood night.  The Sports bar is vey nice place to unwind in the evening and if you enjoy the outdoor then you must go to the rooftop bar, on the weekends you might catch a live jazz band playing.   The gym is also well equipped and has a pool.   One of the new hotels in Lagos.
Nice hotel lovely view a lot of things to do in the hotel e.g bars lounge salon etc etc breakfast was nice. Had a nice experience would definable reccomend the rooms are spacious

Review Title: Credit Card charged twice. Not refunded despite several reminders.
Review Text: I stayed there for 3 nights and at the end of the trip they charged my card twice. Despite several reminders and attempts to get the refund back no one responded. The manager has now stopped responding altogether and the finance department has no answer either.

Review Title: London prices for Lagos quality, horrible
Review Text: I am staying typically 150+ nights per year in 5 Star properties around the world, for business and leisure. I am also a VIP member of many of the established hotel loyalty programs. I'm an Ambassador Member of SPG.  I stayed for 20+ nights in this hotel in about 8 different rooms over multiple trips. Mostly received suite upgrades.  Overall, I must say this is a horrible hotel:  The entire hotel smells mouldy and humid, you even hear water dripping and flowing in some walls,... ¬∞Rooms are large, but not well maintained (noisy/broken/only off-on A/C, bathrooms dirty, in 3 out of 4 rooms there were ants). ¬∞Housekeeping is a no-go: 50% of the time dirty and torn sheets, every single day either not enough or no towels. ¬∞Wifi in the room is more a matter of luck, since reception is

I live in Lagos and decided to get out of the house for the weekend with the kids (no cooking, cleaning, etc.,) without having to get in a plane or drive more than 15 mins.   Rooms were adequately sized, tastefully furnished and comfortable to stay in. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.   Reception tried to overcharge me vs. what they had said on the phone during booking, for two fold-able beds for my kids (aged 2 and 4.) I had to rattle the manager before I was satisfied.   Also had a problem with restaurant staff who hassled me and my wife on two occasions for taking an extra table and chair (there were four of us, they had no high chairs, the tables were too small for me and two of the chairs were fixed to the wall and my daughter didn't want to sit on it.) Anyway there
Review Text

Review Title: One of the better places in Lagos
Review Text: Stayed in this hotel for about 30 nights over the last few months. Comfortable and clean rooms, although the power outages are getting worse. Check-in or check out can be very disorganised at times, but staff in general very friendly. The hotel could clearly not charge these prices for the standard they offering in Europe, but for Nigeria it is not too bad. Definitely a lot of prostitutes in the hotel, but then this is not too different from some of the other large hotels in Lagos.

Review Title: A business hotel, good selection of food, the usual lagos fun of power cuts
Review Text: Located on "the island" offers good modern rooms, a lovely outside bar perfect for sundowners, well protected. Stayed here twice last year and find reception staff a little slow in action and stroppy. Power cuts every evening as per the rest of Lagos, regardless of the number of the generators on the grounds.

Review Title: Anyone for Air Conditioning and NO Sleep because of the ferocius Noise From High Volume Air Flow
Review Text: I have stayed at the hotel on a contract basis, the management dont care about comments as they are content with high occupancy of 85% with communication extremely low.  Depending which room/suite your are allocated you may endure the following:  Excessive Air Flow from Air Con that has to be shut-off otherwise sleep is unbearable Because of the live music Thursdat through Sunday Rooms facing the Office Bar renders it impossible to sleep until aftewr 10:30pm Rooms facing the road renders it possible to have severely broken sleep Towels not replaced, soiled towels left for re-use Room not cleaned Tiled floors generally dirty General care and maintenance poor Hot water sporadic, dirty yellowish water common or no water or scalding hot wate Use of the sweat box gym hard to endure

Back in Lagos again, I stayed 3 weeks in Four Points. Kind staff, well organised but the poyer outages have not been fixed, if possible it is even worse. Bearing in mind that mains electricity barely covers 25% of the local consumption, power outages are not surprising but this hotel, at the rate they charge, should definitely run on generators 24/24. But, there are more prostitutes than in the past, alone at the bar (inside and outside) as well as with customers on the room floors. Since heavy security is available at every door in this hotel, it would be easy for the hotel to stop them. Since they don't, I expect these ladies are paying their way in... This can be the cause for theft or unfriendly behavior in the hotel and is not acceptable in this type of environment.

Review Title: One of best choices in Lagos
Review Text: New hotel, well equipped, modern. Staff quite helpful. there even appear to be managers that actually manage! Together with the Raddison, certainly the best possible choice in Lagos. It is quite expensive, but hell! This is Nigeria and the supply-demand relation is not very favourable for visiting guests...

Review Title: Best in Lagos, Perhaps, but Unacceptable
Review Text: Simply no excuse for the lack of cleanliness, high price, and attempts to take advantage of the traveler. Company office in Lagos booked the hotel, but they lost the reservation. They found a standard room and charged over $400 USD/night. I went online to Sheraton.com and found the same room for $300. They willfully overcharged by $100, and told me I should register online then. Unwilling to adjust the rate. Service is nonchalant about it. Towels are thin. Bed is fine. Internet fast. Power outages are not their fault. Good location.

Review Title: Nice place to stay for business
Review Text: Its a very modern and nice hotel. Although the service was not the best, I enjoyed the stay. The rooms very quite spacious and very nice. The pool area was almost entirely indoors, and not as good as at Southern Sun hotel.  Located nicely in Victoria Island. Takes a while to the mainland, because of all the traffic around the hotel.  No free internet connection in the hotel rooms
Great housekeeping Good food Attentive staff Superb management Overall cleanliness of the hotel is excellent Great weekend live music performers I highly recommend this hotel and I will come again.

Review Title: Expensive, opulent, great hotel for the business man, company executive
Review Text: Located in the rapidly developing Victoria Island lies this massive but elegant Hotel. Courteous staff, good bar and lounges and great cuisine. This is the place for the top echelon. Close to the great Shoprite, Game Plaza and also near the bar beach, this is a secure hotel that is perfect for the local and international biz man and other executives.

A nice hotel overall, but for a 4 star hotel they charge too much money, perhaps because they are bery good hotels in the city  My biggest annoyance as a Muslim visiting from Dubai is the fact that the hotel does not serve Halal Meat for the Muslims.. So i was a hardcore vegetarian with occasional seafood.. For the price i have paid for thos hotel, i was quite disappointed to see that most of the hotel staff, including that in the main restaurant had no clue what 'Halal' Muslim meat is, although Nigeria boasts a sizeable Muslim population.  I would recommend my Muslim friends to do propert research on Halal Food before choosing a hotel to stay in Nogeria

Staff are very friendly, the rooms are pretty luxurious - large in size, comfortable bed and very big bathroom.  Internet is extremely fast and comes free with every room.  The gym is great and the pool, although on the small size is nice and cool and therefore great for proper lengths.  Restaurants serve great food - with a variety of Nigerian and continental dishes.  Highly recommended!

To begin with, Lagos is an extremely scary city for a first time visitor. Four Points Sheraton is a good hotel to be in when you are in Lagos. The security is good, the rooms are clean and they have a good lobby which could serve as your destination to have all your business meetings.  The food was rubbish but I realized the food in Nigeria was rubbish overall so there is no reason to blame the hotel.  The hotel was extremely expensive though. Maybe they could reconsider their pricing since Four Points is supposed to the budget chain for Sheraton.

Review Title: My first choice hotel in the city
Review Text: Four points by sheraton is a very good hotel. My entire stay in this hotel was a pleasant right from interaction with the front desk for check in. The rooms are beautifully decorated, spacious with all the possible amenities. The food is very good. I would definitely want to go back here.

If you have never been to Lagos before or if you are infrequent traveller then the Four Points Sheraton is an excellent choice.Nigeria and Lagos in particular has serious infrastructure challenges,as serious as any mega city I have visited, which of course offers potential for business and the need for such hotels as this.The hotel open space, rooms and restaurant are excellent particularly bearing in mind the obstacles that are many in operating a quality hotel in Nigeria.The internet is very fast,the staff courteous and the hotel is very accessible and thats a big plus in Lagos. I would highly recommend the hotel to any business traveller.

Living in Lagos myself, the lobby at the 4point has served as a place for business meetings for quite a while. Clean, friendly with a nice atmosphere and friendly service. After a long meeting I was too tired to drive home and decided to stay overnight. When rocking up at reception in the evening asking for a room, the rates were actually quite ok at NGN 35k. Still expensive anywhere else in the world, but good value for Lagos. Not sure why they don‚Äôt take Amex or Diners cards which I would have thought standard.  Guess one of the best compliments one can give a hotel in Lagos is that it is a good international hotel. That certainly applies here. Nice hotel room like any up market generic hotel. The choice of the hotel is very important because you'll probably end up staying there all the time after work. Building maintenance is generally known to be of very bad quality so new hotels are always strongly recommended. Four Points started its operation quite recently, so its still new. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, but the AC can sometimes be a bit noisy (I'm not an AC fan and I rarely switch it on so I'm not sure how bad it was). The main restaurant (Brazzerie) offers open buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast is quite good, while dinner depends on the day of the week (some days are better than others). Serious issues to consider in choosing a Lagos hotel include traffic, security and comfort of course! Using that criteria, the hotel quickly becomes 'the Hotel to beat!' in Lagos. Breakfast is a good selection even though it stayed the same daily.  The rooms are nicely spaced with two or three large towels and small ounces of toiletries daily. Review Title: Best Hotel I've stayed in Lagos
Review Text: It is a nice hotel of a good standard. I was traveling with my wife and 6 year old son and they both enjoyed it as well. The staff were very friendly and were not over imposing as we have experienced in other hotels. We only meal we had at the hotel was breakfast which was quite fine. We stayed in an executive room. I don't know what the other rooms look like. The executive rooms were on the upper floors so that could potentially have been the only difference. Although the hotel is quite new, you can already see the signs of wear and tear creeping in. Hopefully they will make more of an effort to maintain the standard than some of the other chain hotels that have come and gone. Review Title: I would love to go back.
Review Text: The hotel was upscale, the food was good, the room great and the bed very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and when requested respectful of privacy.

The staff are the strongest asset of the hotel. They are friendly and professional. Very patient with e-mail enquiries leading up to my stay. After I arrived things didn't always go smoothly, but requests were met with a can do attitude.  Dining is expensive but the local food served at the buffet restaurant is excellent. French bistro theme is rather incongruous though.  I would definitely stay here again.

usually i stay at the fph and i was happy however when i was checking the spg site and found that lagos now has a starwood hotel! the hotel lobby cafe was perfect for meetings and the preffered room was stumptous. i visited the spa and had a st barths fruity body polish ..am  so impressed am now a member of the spa and gym (yay!) its about the same price as fph when u use ur card so maybe its the points i got thats making me excited :))

I only stayed there for 2 nights since my trip was short,but I loved the room decor and the good internet speeds, to bad it's not wireless in the rooms which makes it a bore if you want to work from the bed. The room A/C is ridiculously cold and I spent a good amount of time looking for a button to warm up the room (the bed was to cold). Breakfast is buffet but I'd think for the per night price they'd make it inclusive.

Finding decent accomodation in Lagos used to be very difficult and always very expensive but I recently stayed at the Sharaton Four Points in Lagos. The hotel is new and well built and has decent sized rooms that have all the expected features. The hotel is secure and conveniently located on Victoria Island so if your business is there its much easier to travel to than having to cross the bridge from Ikoyi. Service is good although sometimes a bit slow. The food in the restaurant is very good and their conference facilities are well equipped. Their rates are very reasonable for Nigeria and I would reccomend this hotel for anyone travelling to Lagos who wants a high standard of quality.

Review Title: Best hotel in Lagos for the money
Review Text: First, unless you are a SGP member avoid the other Sheraton, the standard rooms are horrible, SGP ones are not bad. The whole team went to this one for the weekend, everything was excellent. Rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. The biggest surprise/plus was the food. Check out the 2nd floor BBQ at night, food is very good and surprisingly good value, for Lagos premium hotels at least. All in all, we        ll certainly be back, all of us.

Here there are frequent utility breakdowns, but it comes with the territory. The surprising thing about this hotel is the lack of management visibility and they way they hide when things go wrong. For example, the water broke yesterday, so no showers or water in the room. Today there were no towels available as something else had broken down. Guests don't realise that its a general problem because management fail to communicate properly and the staff suffer unnecessarily as a result. I stayed there the first time I came to Lagos and it was one of the best things I experienced during my trip, rooms are very nice, the hotel is relatively new, staff are VERY friendly, my only concern was that i was expecting to find DVD player in the Preferred room since it was stated on the hotel webpage that all rooms are equipped with DVD players but it seems it was a mistake on the website, I would say that definetly If I were to go to Lagos again and enjoy my stay I would for sure stay in four points again.

Review Title: At last a hotel I will return to in Lagos
Review Text: Have stayed at many hotels over the past 8 years: Eco, Proteas, etc, etc.  The Four Points Sheraton is the first proper international style hotel: big spacious rooms, no water problems, fast internet in rooms, 2 bars, 2 restaurants, etc.  Security guard on every floor (bit over the top that).  Will be using this place from now on.  Oh, and central location on Victoria Island.  Great in-room hamburger, try it!!  Good gym and pool.

I have stayed at the Four Point by Sheraton twice this years and each experience is unique and special.... the cozy nature of the rooms is something to savor for a long time. The meals are out of this world!! The friendly and welcoming staff added colour to the whole experience. I shall be back!!

Review Title: Great hotel!! Best of Victoria Island at the moment!
Review Text: I stayed at the Four Points for a business meeting in June 2011. My previous meetings I was staying at the Eko Suites, and kind of expected something similar from the Four Points. I was happily surprised to see the big difference as soon as I arrived: very modern, classy, clean, great finishing and affordable!! I will recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in Victoria Island.

Strategically located; rendering classy service at an affordable value.  A place to be whenever one has a need to stay overmight in the island, and of course a good rendervous for family weekend out as children are provided for in the programm of the Hotel.

Review Title: Good hotel  but a little Expensive
Review Text: I stayed here 2 times and staying the third time as well... It's a good and new hotel with friendly staff who usually give a Damn about your needs... The guest service line usually doesn't get picked up the first time you call... :) They are still ironing out some some small technial issues... like the room i stayed in had very small A.C. water seaping on the sealing... But all in all... the stay here is usually pleasant and relaxing. WiFi is free in the Lobby... But as almost every other place in Lagos... food is very expenive...

Review Title: an oasis of comfort and sophistication in the chaos that is lagos
Review Text: extremely well appointed rooms. in terms of furnishing and appointments. everything works. good bars, a good pool and excellent gym and sauna. reasonable restaurant. and great coffee! no better place to come back to after a hard day in lagos

Review Title: Finally something that is affordable and good service
Review Text: Trying to find a decent hotel to stay in, during a business trip, in Lagos, that doesn't send your company in the "red" is difficult. I think I finally found one, the Four Points by Sheraton is definitively the place to be at. The prices are on par with other international destinations, perhaps the food a little on the expensive side, but for the rest well priced. Nice staff, friendly and always smiling. Good facilities, clean and new. Will definitively return to stay here on my next trip to Lagos.

Review Text: Really friendly and helpful staff. The Cafe in the reception lobby is a good alternative for a coffee/croissant breakfast if you don't want to pay full whack for full buffet breakfast - and the staff at Cafe Cappucino were really nice young people who made you feel welcome - they were great - as were the staff at the Adrenaline Bar - really friendly and helpful. The Happy hour is good and the bar is pretty good when the football is on at least. Internet was hit and miss, lifts a bit slow - but you have the view to look at from the lift . Good hotel - great staff.

I felt very safe at this hotel. There's a security guard on each floor. The personnel at the front desk were always smiling and ready to help me with questions and concerns I had. The room service was prompt and the food was good. The only problem I had was the air conditioner in my room was very noisy. I reported it once and someone came to check it out. It still wasn't fixed, but I didn't pursue the issue. I'm sure if I had they would have fixed it. The atmosphere was tranquil and beautiful. Over all, I would go back. And I recommend it to other travellers.

Excellent value by Nigerian standards--by that I mean:  hotels in Lagos tend to be expensive;  this one was good value and the service was equal or better than what I'm accustomed to in the States or Europe.  There's not much to see or do in Lagos so I was stuck in the hotel most of the time, and I didn't end up feeling antsy.  I thought the staff were excellent.

Wonderful large room, nicely furnished. Fast internet connection. Large bath. On site restaurant is lacking. I found it full of dirty tables and was even seated at a table with dirty linens and so I moved after being seated once I found a table with a clean enough table linen. The buffet served is not well maintained.  I will not go back to the restaurant, however, I will stay at the hotel again because of the wonderful room. Bell service is lacking. I had to go back down and get my own luggage at check in because they were not prompt in getting it up to my room. Good security everywhere. As mentioned in other reviews, the power in the hotel does go on and off occasionally.

On a positive note, I have to say that their housekeeping is amazing- the room was always up to par every night (Although, I would suggest leaving more than 2 bath towels in the room). I usually stay at the Southern Sun on Ikoyi when I'm in Lagos, but its safe to say that the bar just got raised with the arrival of Four Points.  Yeah, its got some teething problems, but none that won't be sorted out as the year progresses. Everyone's there to help, the room's are spacious, beds comfy, food nice and they've got a great pool. Plus everything works when the power's on (apart from my safe!).   You really can't go wrong and I recommend it to all. My Southern Sun days are over.

Having stayed at the Four Point Sheraton Lagos before and fell in love with it, I decided to bring my wife along to experience the Hotel as a treat on our Wedding anniversary. She has since not stopped talking about the hotel and how she would love to go back there. So, I now have to take herand out two kids back to the hotel for the Easter holidays.  She liked the room decor, the lobby ambiance and the excellent service. The staff were very friendly. During diner at the restaurant, she noted that the feel was very personal and would love to revisit. Unfortunately, we did not have breakfast because our flight out was at 8AM and we had to leave the hotel at 6:30 to catch the flight in Ikeja. She is really looking forward to revisiting the hotel and this time, staying a bit longer

Hotels are very expensive at Lagos and as of now the choice is very limited if you are looking at 4/5 Star accommodation. There's the Southern Sun Ikoyi (earlier known as Sofitel Moorhouse Ikoyi) in Ikoyi/Victoria Island Area and the other Sheraton near the Airport. And that's it. Two other hotels are coming up... The Oriental is almost opposite this Four Points and expected to open shortly and ditto for the Radisson Blue in Victoria Island. Given that limited choice, I would rate the Four Points as the second best 4/5 Star accommodation at Lagos after the Southern Sun Ikoyi.  Service is very friendly and sincere but slow. Actually it is a little more complicated than that. Room Service and Housekeeping is prompt and efficient. Front desk is friendly and helpful but slow.

Visiting from London I stayed at the recently opened 4 Points By Sheraton, Lagos in February & I was impressed by the restaurants, and the range of bars on site.   The level of cleanliness was of a high standard & the service was pretty impeccable throughout the hotel.  The hotel has definitely hit the ground running & its set a new standard in the arena of hospitality in Nigeria.  It will remain my hotel of choice for future visits & I look forward to returning in the near future.

Later at night we had a fantastic evening at the Sports Bar, that turned into a Club on Saturday night.

The is the best hotel I have ever stayed in in Nigeria. The staff is wonderful. I was taking my kids to Nigeria for the first time and they loved the selection of Nigerian dishes at the main restaurant, which also doubles as a french restaurant, in the hotel.  The hotel has a car hire service for $100 dollars a day including the driver. Our driver, Peter was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The only thing the Eko Suites, Federal Palace Hotel and Hilton have over this hotel is they are situated in larger compounds. I would recommend this hotel over them any day though.

Review Title: Best rooms, spa, gym and changing rooms :D
Review Text: We have probably stayed at all the major hotels in Lagos and this one by far superseded all our expectations. We stayed in a preferred room and we were genuinely impressed. The spa's infastruscture is amazing and by far the best in Lagos, the gym and changing rooms are suberb, very clean and with lovely saunas!

Everything was a dream! I have lived and vacated almost in every continent but I must say this hotel blew me away, the decor, cleanliness, customer service and the meals at the brazzerie was beyond wonderful. Be aware though that the rooms might be too cold for some people, I live in Virginia and wasnt expecting to freeze my B off in Nigeria...anyways by the next day, things were warmer. The manager was prompt and a real proffessional. I couldnt believe how nice and friendly they were. I asked for a rollaway bed and they only charged me one flat rate! I enjoyed my stay and my family is already planning another trip soon to Four Points!

Review Title: Great Way of Life In Lagos
Review Text: I had been looking forward to experiencing the Four Points hospitality in Nigeria and kept monitoring the SPG website. Once it opened its doors and I had a meeting in Lagos, I immediately jumped at the idea of staying in the hotel and must say, I WAS VERY IMPRESSED.  The hotel met every international standard and more. Very clean, extremely friendly staff, nice rooms and very comfortable bed that makes you not want to get up in the morning. The food is excellent and the layout of the restaurant is beautiful.  Cost is rather on the high side, but for that standard and compared with other hotels in Nigeria, it is the most reasonable of them all.  Compared to other Four Points Sheratons, I would score this one 95% and recommend it highly to visitors to Lagos.
